family guy is excellent as it does some really funny bits like take the Micky out of star wars so many times (to add to that Seth is a star wars fan as you don't reference star wars as much as he has without being a fan of the show) peter is funny in his own right especially when he is being sexist, loris is great much better than Marge from the Simpson's who has weird hair and talks like something from star trek, meg is a bit annoying but i love it when they make fun of her and blame her for everything, Chris is a little slow but is funny with that voice by Seth green (funny guy) stewie is brilliant, witty, funny and is brilliant with Brian who is my favourite character as he is sarcastic, takes advantage of stewie and his love for Loris is really funny as you wonder is it ever going to happen (porbably not but it would be funny if it did happen) other characters like quagmire, Cleveland and Joe are funny,good and make the show more interesting i think family guy will go on to outlast the Simpson's in production as they can get away with a lot more than the Simpson's can but family guy is genius in its own right and people who criticise it are jealous of its successes and that its own or favourite shows are becoming more rubbish i.e. the Simpson's and south park

"Family Guy" is one of the best series to ever come on Fox since "The Simpsons". Each and every episode I've seen was hilarious, except for the "lost" episode, which was the least fun out of all the episodes. Nearly everything about the series is great, but I do have a couple gripes with the show; it isn't as witty, funny, nor original as "South Park", "The Simpsons", and "MST3K", but those shows are pretty much unbeatable in my opinion. The episodes also don't repeat as well as as the previous shows, but this is still a can't miss series. While it isn't as good as the other shows I mentioned, this is one of the greatest adult series to ever grace television of this generation. Fox is very stupid for canceling this show, and I seriously hope that this great series doesn't get picked up by this channel, since they focus on more crap like "American Idol", "Method & Red", and "Quintuplets".

Ignore the comment before mine. The show is comic genius, most underrated show ever. 3 reasons why. Reason 1, the flashbacks are hilarious, who cares if they have absolutely nothing to do with the story, they make me laugh so hard it hurts and isn't that the idea of a good comedy programme? People who think this isn't funny just have no sense of humour. Who cares if they are random, its a t.v. show, you can do what ever you like with it and people say its not realistic, neither is a cartoon, its animated. Reason 2, The jokes are just generally hilarious, Seth McFarlane and the other writers are soooooooooooo funny, everything from the Star Wars references to making fun of celebrities, i love them all. And Reason 3, the story lines are just brilliant and funny, they set up all of the jokes with their crazy nature and wackiness, just all the more funnier.I caught this one late night on BBC2 and have never gone back, i have all 7 seasons, plus the kind of movie thing (Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story), i have several t-shirts, posters and my collection is still growing. I've never got a collection of any TV show before but this was so funny i just had to get everything. Just watch season 3 and trust me you will be hooked for life, the funniest show ever created and i hope it never ends!

The greatest thing about watching family guy is that you know its going to be different. It is really unpredictable and very originall. simple story line. Surburban, Irish, working class family living in Rhode Island and there daily life which is always strange but very funny. The show has everything to make it memorable. A sophisticated talking dog, a baby obsessed with ruling the world, a Homer Simpson like dad. When you first watch it you might struggle to understand whats going on but i think thats the pointThink the classic humour of The Simpsons with a mix of south park. expect witty remarks and hilarious situations. you probably wont relate to this like you would with The Simpsons. But if you don't take this too seriously this is one of the funniest animated shows there is.

What can i say about Family Guy? Oh yes. It is absolutely funny and has a lot of laugh-out gags and jokes but this is the show that has the most memorable characters like Peter Griffin and Stewie Griffin. Wow, Seth MacFarlane is far or more the genius of animation just like Matt Groening except more crude and adult-like. The humor in this show is absolutely the best and far way over the top.I love Herbet the Pervert in this series, oh my god it is just my memorable moment for Family Guy because of him being a elder pervert and has my opinions on the funniest character in the show. In memorial of Brian Griffin in Life of Brian, horrible episode then revived, aaaah better 10/10

The show is one of my favorite animated television shows, but some of the jokes are actually racist. You know, one that bothers you in your religion or color, etc. etc. Since I'm a Christian, nearly always they have something that mentally scars my religious ways for a couple of days.Sure, I agree that Quagmire's really weird personalty is cool, but this is like the Simpsons, except with more weird into it. I don't really say this is a cross between the Simpsons and South Park, but some of the jokes are really corny, not really racist, though.The voice actors are decent, sometimes they're really annoying. I'm used to it, though.

Here's the thing, this is one of my favorite shows. I own all the current DVD sets and plan on getting the next one when it comes out. The great thing about this show is that it's just something fun to watch.It's all personnel preference some people dislike this show because of some of the humor. A lot of the humor has a sexual tone and other so called "edgy" humor that some might object to, so if that's you just go ahead and stop reading because this show isn't for you.There are very few shows that I can watch over again and this is one of them. It has some of the best comedy sequences and quotations I've heard or seen. Now yes don't get me wrong there are some parts that do drag on, but what do you expect not every joke is gonna be pitch perfect there's always a few low points and some episodes you won't like.There's a few you do to keep a little bit of your immaturity, You can't be serious all the time so if you want a good enjoyable show watch that'll make you laugh this is one that is definitely worth it.

Family guy by far is my favorite adult animated show, I have been watching for almost 10 years now and I still think it's as funny now as it was when I first watched it. I was a kid then so not all the jokes got through but now re watching past episodes and understanding some of the adult jokes I have an even funner time watching this show. Although the only problem with the show I have is the fact that I've been watching for 10 years and some characters can get a bit annoying now, so every once in awhile I'll give myself a few months away from the show. My favorite character on the show is Chris griffin because he's played by one of my favorite childhood actors in Seth green. Also I love how Chris just adds onto his fathers dumbness when it comes to picking on Meg. Chris is one character that after 10 years I am still able to say I love that character. Overall I'd say family guy is a hilarious show with no real down points unless you've been watching for a long time like me.

Started to watch this Sitcom. So much funny clip are coming in my fb, tiktok and YT feed some dark some so funny so i decided to watch this. So let's see how is this series. Too long don't know when will I finished this, still the office is on pending i am on s4.

It's just started being shown over here in the UK, so I thought I'd try it. It's good. It's really good. Very funny, the scripting is spot on, and the characters grow on you right away, they don't need introductions, they are just there, in your face, and you love them. Especially Stewie, he is brilliant.If you like animation, try it out, that's what I did, and I loved it...

Family Guy is just like the Simpsons. 2/3 "whoo-hoo!" and 1/3 'D'OH!'The non-threatening comedy is hilarious(i.e: Peter knocks a golf ball into a china shop, destroying everything while a bull is reading the magazine. The angry owner sneers at the bull who replies, 'I know what you're thinking!'), the suggestive but nor so harsh humor is cute, but the adult language has got to go! That is stupid, and Seth McFarlane, the man behinf Family Guy knows it. There's a person who can't stand the show, and for good reason. Too harsh for its own good. Sure, I can use Stewie to help me get rid of some scum I hate, some of them are critics with no taste who got me POed with their lousy reviews. But overall, the show needs less raunch and more slapstick! Offensive comedy ain't funny. It's offensive! And stupid. Peter Griffin is an idiot with a woman's butt for a chin.

Despite the criticism that it received(about the voices, themes and the simplicity of the animation), I think that "Family Guy" deserves all the popularity that it has.It is true that at first sight it seems to be a clone of the Simpsons, but the style and the humor is quite different and quite effective too. The cultural references are effective, and shocking sometimes (That is what makes the show funny) and about the animation, I think that it fits very well with the style of the show. And the complaints concerning taste and indecency are exaggerated: It is true that the show has violence and sexual jokes, but it was never intended to children. There are many shows that are more offensive and explicit and that don't receive the same criticism ( Like, by example "Drawn Together")Even when the humor isn't "sophisticated" it doesn't makes it stupid or puerile. It is just the style of the show. With it good and bad things " Family Guy " is a very good show.Not the best, but good.

As Lionel Hutz himself once said, if it weren't for ripoffs, we wouldn't have nearly as many enjoyable shows as we currently do. But to call Family Guy merely a "Simpsons ripoff" is very short sighted. Family Guy is an acquired taste, and if you didn't like the first episode, you most likely will never be able to get into it. I find it to be hilarious, unlike shows like Futurama that stay on the air all year thanks to the star power behind them. There is a way to explain how Family Guy is not only different from the Simpsons, but is also a suitable replacement when the inevitable time comes, but chances are that if you don't understand Family Guy, you wouldn't understand the explanation either. Bottom line: It's a very good show, and Fox needs to wake up and realize that they have a potential cartoon dynasty on their hands if they would just replace Futurama with Family Guy on Sunday Nights.

Contrary to what the title says, I like both shows but "Family Guy" has some scenes that make me laugh so hard I almost choke. The funniest one that I can think of is the "Mentos" parody. I laughed SO hard tears were rolling down my face and I was still laughing way after that scene was over!! I can't WAIT for the season premiere of FG to start but the bad part is that it's going to be on Thursday nights opposite "Frasier" and "Chicago Hope" so my mom, dad and I are going to fight over the two TVs we own come September. BUT I WILL WIN IN THE END!! HA HA HA!!!!Anyway, I would recommend this show to people. They'd be kicking themselves when the show is cancelled(hopefully that's not for a LONG time)and are not able to catch it on the tube anymore.

Family Guy is a cartoon that you sometimes wonder why it was rated PG. Whether it's newsman Tom Tucker being found with a prostitute, Griffin child Stewie commenting on how the cheerleaders are lucky he's not after there more...intimate regions or Quagmire...well anything Quagmire says, really. But mixed in with this shocking humour is some really sharp dialogue and surreal flashes that combined with the shows lack of PC makes for a very good mix. Like the Simpsons it more feels at home satirising aspects of society than actual events themselves and like the Simpsons it has a good mix of characters including Brian and Stewie the cynical smoking dog and the dominating evil baby respectively who really set the show apart from the Simpsons. Having said that however, the show doesn't seem to get away enough with Peter the dumb father beginning to remind us all of a bald round father from another show...Also, while the show is great the first time around, it doesn't have the depth of Futurama nor the Simpsons to lift it to their class. Nevertheless, Family Guy is a good show and I can't wait for the movie later this year.

Family Guy is a hilarious example of the explosion of more adult-themed animation that has taken place over the past ten years. One of the earliest and most successful of the genre, it plays like a combination of The Simpsons and South Park, blended together with a puree of pop culture references.Family Guy has evolved over the seasons-and the two cancellation periods. If you watch the earliest episodes, they are much tamer than those that followed in the second and third seasons, almost as if the writers were unsure of how far they could go. Furthermore,the characters, within the limits of a half hour sitcom, have themselves evolved. Brian in particular has been fleshed out well.This is never going to be great drama, and it is certainly not something you would show to the children. Nevertheless, if you want a good laugh, this show is the place to go.

Of all the current animated sitcoms ("Futurama," "The PJs," "King of the Hill," "Dilbert," "The Simpsons," "South Park," "The Family Guy"), only one stinks. It's "The Family Guy." The stories are stupid, the characters are one-dimensional ripoffs, and the animation is flat and uninteresting.The megalomaniacal baby and the hyperintelligent dog are both ripped off from Dogbert, and they are the only characters that have any personality at all. Unfortunately, the baby is merely annoying (and majorly so).Hopefully Fox will cancel this stinkeroo soon and put the far superior "Futurama" back in its cushy 8 p.m. Sunday time slot.

This is one awesome show, and here are the reasons why. First, there are random scenarios episode after episode. Second, the series has dozens of popular culture. For example, in the episode, "I dream of Jesus", Peter rediscovers his favourite song of all time: Surfin' Bird. I have been inspired to love Surfin' Bird and drive my family crazy with it. The first time I have watched an entire episode of Family Guy, was when I was eleven, and I was totally hooked on it, even though it's vulgar, it's funny! What else I love best about Family Guy is that it even did the Star Wars Trilogy, and I totally loved it!! The most hilarious episode would be "The Splendid Source", where it involves Peter laughing at a dirty joke so hard, he poops his pants. Every time that happened, I burst out laughing so loudly, my parents could hear me all the way upstairs, because I was in the basement.

> This show is the single greatest thing to come out of America since The > Simpsons.  Not only does it have thousands of new ideas, but it's actually > controversial (see the Jewish joke, Season 1, Episode 1) and isn't scared to > "tick" people off.  However, the great minds at Fox have canceled it, along > with Greg the Bunny and Futurama, so make sure you buy the Season 1 box set > while you still can.  It'll be the best money you ever spend. It is a very good show. Amongst the top cartoons I have ever seen. Now people say it is a bad show for all the jokes where they cut away. But i think it is intelligent and feel that this show has great potential. It is but some shows can have very good plots and revelations. But I have to say I am being disappointed with some episodes of season 12 and 13, especially the brain death sequence. But other then that it is a great show and i recommend it.It is a great comedical show, even if you are not taking it seriously then still sitting down every few days and watching a few episodes for the laughs is fun. But like every show it has it's bad episodes which disappoint me and very good episodes. overall a great show, but be wary it ISN'T a family show lol

Family Guy is kinda an overrated show, like that one time where I did something that required breaking up the pace of a show with a cut away that gets old after the first time. The Stewie character is kinda like that one time I went ahead and acted like a complete moron and started saying stupid things hoping people would laugh, stuff like "I'm going to kill you mother" which isn't that cool since my mom's dead. Watching this show is kinda like that one time I watched the Simpsons. Or any other cartoon that Family Guy ripped off. Peter's a funny character, kinda like that one time when funny meant genocidal, like Stalin, ya know, that one time... Lois's character is kinda like that one time when I watched an episode of the Nanny and didn't laugh. Oh, as for Brian, he's kinda like that one time that dogs don't talk. But I'm willing to let that slide because it's a cartoon. His alcoholism I won't allow though, alcohol is evil, just like Mila Kunis. I got to admit this show is really damn funny and honestly the older seasons are WAY more funny than the newer seasons and guide for the parents about this show I started watching this when I was 15 because this is not a show for very young children it's kinda obvious by the tv-14 aka ages 14 and up rating.

Family Guy has been hilarious for so long but I feel like it lost it's sharp and random humor at the start of season 6. Although I enjoyed Blue Harvest, it felt like the remaining episodes were "wrapping-up" - episodes where the producers made little attempt to fulfill Family Guy's reputation of American social satire.I have seen all the episodes from season 7 and I was utterly surprised and happy that Family Guy has found their true colors again. Season 7 delivers a lot of fantastic episodes and with a lot of jokes about the current situations in America which is exactly what we need right now - more fun.I feel that the Simpsons has lost its spark all together, this show, however, has made a terrific recovery from going down to proving how perfectly satirical they can be. Great job!

So before Family Guy i pretty much settled on The Simpsons because they were the only watchable adult animated show(don't get me wrong I love The Simpsons but it was getting a bit old) but then in 1999 a great master named Seth Macfarlane came from above shared with us his creation Family Guy and it was like a match made in heaven, I mean it had my crude humor of tasteless jokes so a I got addicted watching every episode and every rerun they put on TV.And after a while I found myself repeating every single joke in my head and to my friends and forcing them to watch every episode with me. And then came the dark ages. Family guy got CANCELLED and I went into shock and bought every family product ever made and of course all the DVD's and overdosed a couple of times by watching a whole series in one sitting again and again.Then one wonderful morning when I was finally starting to stop or at least cut down on my Family Guy watching dozes I got the amazing news that they were bringing them back because of amazing DVD sales. So you can Imagen I was stoked and when it came back on it was like it had never left. So now couple years later I am still addicted and watch every episode every week religiously but I am not as crazy as I used to be.P.S to answer your question no I don't have life.

It was too funny - I have rarely seen a show that so cleverly pokes fun at every aspect of our popular culture.  Any time you combine a matricidal baby, a talking dog, a slew of flashbacks, and Seth Green, you just can't miss.

Now, I like this show a lot. It's funny and it's fresh. The voice acting is amazing and the cutaway's are really funny at times. It really does make me laugh. I watch it some nights and it's always nice to sit down and watch it. But it does have its bad points.The good: Some of the humour is funny, it's amazing how they have only used a few voice actors, some of the more offensive humour isn't out there to just offend people. Also even their British assumptions are funny!!The bad: THE humour is repetitive, it uses aids and cancer as jokes, toilet humour completely over used, and steals jokes from The Simpsons and other shows that said them way before they did.8/10It's good, but it does need to freshen up a bit.

I do enjoy this show, to this day I watch the repeats on Cartoon Network's Aduilt Swim. What other show would have the lead character fight a giant man size chicken over a expired coupon. An evil baby wanting to rule the world and a talking dog. I give it 9 Stars *********ON THE POSITIVE SIDE (+ HITS) + FUNNY (extremely funny, one of the funniest shows since the Simpsons) + CHARACTERS (Clever writing in the characters) + WRITING (Some of the best writing around)ON THE NEGATIVE SIDE (- MISSES)SATIRE (Some people may not like the satire) - NOT FOR KIDS (This is not a cartoon for kids)

Family Guy used to be the funniest animated sitcom and my favorite animated sitcom on TV. I was never a big fan of the Simpsons, South Park, King of the Hill or any other animated sitcom. This show falls somewhere between the mainstream family-friendly Simpsons and the overtly crass South Park. Nevertheless, it is about as un-PC as you can get and makes fun of virtually everyone.However, beginning around 2006 shortly after coming back on-air this show started to go downhill and lost its edge. All of the jokes became centered around Quagmire's hatred of Brian or his overzealous sex life, cutaway bits that are drawn out to the point of awkwardness, constant pop culture references, or flashbacks that start along the lines of "This is more ____ than that time I _____" or "This is like that time I _____". While this show has lost its originality and creativity it's still better than most of the mindless crap on TV today. I continue to watch reruns of the old shows on Adult Swim but once it gets past Season 4 (2005-2006ish) I stop watching.

This has got to be one of the most overrated shows on the face of the Earth.I watch this whenever it comes on the jokes are hilarious although they can be very stupid.This show absolutely fails in plots because each one is over-run by mindless gags and random cutaways. This show centers around the Griffins, a dysfunctional family living in the fictional city of Quahog, Rhode Island. The main character Peter Griffin is an idiot but very funny because he always doing unbelievably stupid things,it kinda has you wondering why Lois griffin (his wife) married a doofus like him.The other characters Brian,Stewie,Meg and Chris can be funny but not as funny as Peter.

It never seizes to amaze me what passes for entertainment these days...This show appeals to docile sheep who believe they are viewing something edgy and groundbreaking. I'm sorry folks, you're not.It's simple humour designed for immature people. I love the Simpsons and South Park and although they may be viewed as immature, on a latent level, they are so much more.I think I see the appeal. It's a show that relies on an endless supply of popular culture references and other random obscurities. The common reaction? "Wow, that's so random! I can't believe they ACTUALLY referenced that. I am so witty for getting that obscure reference...etc." This is such a hollow form of comedy. I think the South Park episode about the manatees says it all.To each their own I guess.

Family guy is truly amazing it's humor style has changed since earlier seasons however unlike most shows which lose the shine it's just adapted and become even more entertaining! I'm sorry to hard core Simpsons fans but that show should of been cut after the tenth season it's horrifically blunt and seems to be aimed at three year old's family guy has a certain aura that points out all the things that's wrong with society and still manages to make you laugh even when you don't agree it's fantastic! I can't get enough of this show I hope it never ends ( unless it goes sour) it deserves a freaking Oscar or whatever it is series get!!!!!!!!

I grew up with the Simpsons and in my view it is the best, but The Family Guy would be number 2. Only because of its short run, but it is a very funny show. And I have more of an urge to watch that show than the Simpsons. I mean we have all heard of Bart, Homer, Mo, and Mr. Burns. But Stewie, Brian, Peter, and Chris don't get the comedic justice that should be theirs. The cool thing about this show is that each character has a style of comedy that different people will love. I like the Simpsons, but Homer is the Kramer of that show. The comedy is also around the same area, but The Family Guy has different styles. Sometimes I'll like Stewie, then Brian, the Chris; I can never choose one. The show kicks butt and is good enough to buy and watch.
My style of comedy is more of a black comedy style. So I love this show because it is black comedy, at least 60 percent. That could be the reason that it didn't last long, but it makes a good show. The other 40 percent is wit, ordinary jokes, and funny situations as well as weird occurrences. A good thing to do is to watch this show, then the Simpsons, and choose. To say again I like the Simpsons and know why it lasts, but I love this show. I may never get bored of it.

One thing I've noticed about the reviews of the people who hate Family Guy is the redundant and tired argument that it is a rip off of The Simpsons. While the main character set up within is the same, there are overwhelming variations. Family Guy has a smaller number of characters, and is not afraid to introduce new, fresh characters to provide variation. The Simpsons stuck with a large character base that they have used for many seasons. The constant moral preaching of The Simpsons is not present in Family Guy. In fact, Family Guy have taken the warped, Americanized idea of morality and moral preaching (which is vague beyond belief), and used it to spin together some clever satirical sequences. There are numerous differences I could run over, but I only have 1000 words to work with, so I won't waste any more time pointing out what should be clear to people already. The voice work is pretty good, though if you searched really hard for a weakness, the voice work would have to take the cake. Fundamental characters who are voiced by a specialist are high standard, but Seth MacFarlane's vocal linguistics are not always on the money. A lot of voices echo Brian in a way, and Brian's voice is based mainly on Seth MacFarlane's actual voice. Despite this, I find the commonly used voice work within the family intelligent and witty, as it slots in well with each character. At the end of the day, a tiny flaw in the voice work drag Family Guy down. The episodes follow a formula, though because the writers Family Guy have established this formula, it's not boring or dated). The episodes deal with simple story lines which integrate flashbacks and both modern and retrospective pop culture references. What you get is a show that doesn't tread on irrelevant ground, but walks on irrelevant water. It's sharp switch of focus may be off putting for some, but at the end of the day, you can't complain about the structure when Family Guy delivers the amount of jokes it does. There are a huge number of memorable quotes (to list them all would probably take hours), which would get a laugh from most open - minded, thoughtful people. The fact that people have the audacity to assume that this show is aimed directly at immature school boys makes me wonder what's happened to people in this day and age. The last sentence of the above paragraph leads me to my final point; the people who rubbish Family Guy manage to drown themselves in recessive ridiculous rhetoric. Yes, I did use alliteration. Where you able to spot that? If you were, then you should be able to detect the irony, satire, wit, and playful sarcasm of Family Guy. I've only listed a number of techniques Family Guy uses, but seriously, how can you not spot irony in Family Guy? You only need to look at the theme song which claims we need to be remember "good old fashioned values". Family Guy couldn't get any worse at reminding us about values, making the theme song ironic. Don't claim that Family Guy allegedly doesn't contain irony, satire, etc. when you cannot spot it yourself. If you have had the pleasure of viewing "Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story", they even slip into deliberate self parody and point out the irony for the audience:Fireman #1: The fire was due to these stress relief candles. Fireman #2: Irony!If you can't grasp comic concepts, go watch excrement like The War At Home. I'm sure that won't be too intelligent for you. Also, watch the grammar (not so much spelling, I know typos happen), if you're posting about how stupid Family Guy supposedly is. There is nothing more satisfying for me than to watch skeptics make glaring contradictions. Clean up your arguments.That's about all from me, submit any questions or hateful incoherent comments like "I ws so ryt lol" to my Private Message Inbox.

FG is fantastic I've got every season on DVD and they just keep getting funnier, generally its the same type of set-up as the simpsons full of strange and ridiculous characters, parodies and dovetailing,(two stories meet). The humour is very well done and extremely broad it encompasses parodies which only a select group would understand,un-political correctness for older audience, clever jokes which would go over the the head of those "less educated" members of society, weird sketch with just make u think "What the hell?" and of course raw comic slapstick. all in all family guy is a great show and this is proved by the fact that the network brought it it back after cancelling it, not many show can claim that!

I love The Simpsons. I love The X Files. I hate the fact that I have to sit through this show for 1/2 hour in between. Actually, I think they just put Futurama in the 8:30 slot, can I get an Amen?Last night, they're watching the tv.. Mintos commercial.. Assassinating Lincoln recreation? That's supposed to be funny? and then the fat guy walks away.. "Must kill Lincoln" reeks of Homer.And am I the only one to notice something else these guys are trying to get away with? The dad, the son, some of the other male characters?? I can't stand it, but dammit, I CAN NEVER FIND MY REMOTE CONTROL AT 8:30 ON SUNDAY NIGHTS AND I DON'T KNOW HOW TO WORK THE TV BUTTONS!! THIS SHOW MUST BE DESTROYED.

There are episodes of this show that are truly hilarious. This is true often enough to make this show very entertaining. The comedy tends to be very very blue, but in general, the show is so bizarre that it's difficult to get too offended by most of it. Story lines that involve Brian and Stewie are really the most interesting characters on the show. Because these two characters are the smarter characters on the show, and because they're very existence forces the viewer to suspend disbelief, they tend to end up with the strangest and most humorous plots and subplots, as well as the smarter jokes. However, there are times where it is less than inspired, and times where the jokes really are just offensive. . I think some racial and religion jokes can be very funny, and are often funny as presented on the show, but they are overused and therefore get very old very fast. Just a heads up: Anne Frank jokes are not funnyThe other characters are good sometimes, and at times aren't very interesting. Peter being stupid and bigoted can be very funny, but is a little overdone. It is very difficult to believe that Lois would actually stay with him, regardless of her implied moral ambiguity. The way he treats Meg has it's moments of twisted humor, but is often uncomfortable to watch. Is it really that funny to watch someone be verbally and at times physically abused by her family and her peers to the point where she becomes mentally ill? Meg's character is a giant question mark, because she's really not very sympathetic, which I'm sure is intentional, but she's not very well written. At some point, Meg's semi-psychotic behavior and her social isolation needs to give way to some other character traits Chris? Well, Chris's character is secondary at most. Even plots that center around something going on in Chris's life tend to be more about Peter's reaction to them than Chris. Perhaps it's better this way.This show is inconsistently very funny. It is funny often enough to make it worth recommending, but there are certainly episodes worth skipping.

The summary line probably sums how I feel about this show in a nutshell. Having said that,that actually can be both a mark against AND a mark for it.The plots of each episode are almost completely irrelevant. Mostly,each episode is a very well-threaded series of pop-culture references and gags to inflate the stories involving the Griffith family of Quahog(spelling?),Rhode Island(?):patriarch Peter,a very corpulent man who loves to watch television and drink beer with his buddies,Joe(a wheelchair-bound former cop),Glen(a joyfully perverted loser)and Cleveland,Peter's apparent lone black friend. His wife Lois is seemingly domestic and average but actually comes from wealth and hides a fairly(Ahem)active past. Daughter Meg is a loserish awkward teen who still manages to get on with life despite it all. Son Chris is almost functionally retarded. Infant son Stewie has the voice and mind of an evil genius(think equal parts Vincent Price character,Dr.No and Simon Bar-Sinister from "Underdog"). And last but not least,the family dog Brian is an articulate,thoughtful,upright walking man's best friend that puts up with the family.The trick to liking this show,in my estimation is that one not try to weigh in on each joke or plot device,and just let the pictures and events roll. Chances are,you'll find something that will make you laugh in varying degrees and frequency. Trivia: this show has the distinction of being somewhat of a "Rasputin"(i.e. show that can't seem to be killed) since the FOX network actually had this show canceled THREE TIMES between 1999 and 2002 before they relented(due to heavy pressure from fans,of course,aided by Cartoon Network reruns,of course)and re-slotted the show on the continuous run it's been on since 2003. Anyone who enjoys a good hearty round of t.v. and movie referencing punctuating loose and (mostly)good-natured plots I feel won't be disappointed by this show.

I have to say, this is by far my favorite show on television.Every Sunday night at 9:30 (We dvr it to fast forward through the commercials) my Dad and I (I'm 17) gather to watch our favorite show, Family Guy. Its never disappointing, we are always laughing our butts off through the entire show. The side clips are original and even though many of the story lines aren't, Peter's antics make them hilarious. I especially like the episodes with just Stewie and Brian because their personalities are so different. They interact in a way that none of the other characters do. To address many recent reviews about the original episodes (before it got canceled and brought back) that say they are better then the new ones I must say I completely disagree. I have watched most of the episodes since 2000 (I was never allowed to watch it until I was 14 but I dvr'd them on Cartoon Network) and I find them to be overly raunchy and frankly not funny. Stewie hadn't developed into the Stewie we know and love and Brian had very few roles in the episodes. It was mostly Peter doing stupid things that weren't very funny. For example, one episode he pretended to be the Fonz at a high school where Chris went. He tried to act stupid but all he really did was walk around like a cool kid. I've seen some of the Fonz antics and Peter basically did these as himself. In the new episodes Peter does completely random and original things such as adopting 30 puppies because he thinks he's dreaming. The puppies begin to do some inappropriate things to him but it remains hilarious, one day to cheer Chris up he got him a bull frog and poked a bunch of holes in it's back to let it breath. When he opened the box he saw that instead of allowing the frog to breath he had stabbed it to death. His reaction was hilarious. I will say the best episodes were from 2005-2009 but it still remains hilarious to me. There is a reason it remains the highest rated show on Animation Domination you know.

Humor Wins Television shows get cancelled all the time, but is it possible for a television show to get cancelled and come back to life even better than it was the first time? "No way!" you may think, but it happened with the hit T.V. series Family Guy. Family Guy is a great T.V. show because its use of comedy is one of a kind. Not everybody is going to like the show, but if you are a fan you will find its political incorrectness very funny.Fox, who is known for its early T.V. show cancellations, cut Family Guy in 2002 after three seasons. There ended up being such a high demand for the DVD series that Fox decided to put Family Guy back on the air, returning to television in May 2005 with its fourth season. There is no question that the fourth season is as funny if not funnier than the seasons before it.The show is set in the fake town of Quahog, Rhode Island and is centered around the very dysfunctional Griffin Family. Peter, the father figure, is the head of the household. Sometimes driven wild by her own crazy family, Lois, the mother, is the peace maker. Chris, the son, is not only slow physically but also mentally. Meg is the mistreated daughter who doesn't have many friends. Stewie, the baby of the family, can talk but I don't believe anyone in the family can actually hear him. Occasionally consuming alcoholic beverages, Brian the family's talking dog, rounds out the cast. Even more unique than the characters themselves is the style in which Family Guy is written. It's comprised of a sort of sarcastic fast paced dry humor that requires the viewer to not only be aware of what's happening on the show, but also what's happening in the real world. Although the overall story may not always be funny, the jokes and situations are witty, clever, and undoubtedly entertaining. It's amazing how the writers can come up with crazy ideas and implement them into this irregular family's life. There are many pop culture references in Family Guy, and a lot of "That was like the time<U+0085>" flashback moments. You can never tell what is going to happen next. If you think you have a hunch, most of the time you will end up undoubtedly wrong. In one episode Lois and Brian have to go find Peter out in the woods. Brian says "Don't worry Lois I was the one who found George Bush after Hurricane Katrina." The next scene has Brian walking up to a tree house and yelling "Mr. President, are you up there?" Next it shows George Bush poking his head out of the tree house, and he says "Go away" Brian then says "Sir there is a disaster in New Orleans that you have to deal with." Finally George Bush says "Don't make me do stuff." This is a perfect example of the shows political incorrectness, and it's off the wall comedy. Obviously the writers of Family Guy are not in favor of the President and disagreed with the way he handled Hurricane Katrina. By using scenes from earlier episodes during flashbacks, viewers tend to watch the show more regularly so as not to miss out or be overcome with confusion. One of the recurring gags in Family Guy is when they take a quick joke and overdo it almost to the point of being awkward, but in doing so it actually makes it even funnier. In the episode Patriot Games, Peter gets invited to play with the New England Patriots. After he scores a touchdown, he celebrates by singing a song called "Shipoopi". As he is singing and dancing to this song the entire crowd sings along. While the cheerleaders, referees, and Peter's teammates are the back up dancers. This goes on for a long time, and finally at the end of the celebration Peter says to himself, "I made a touchdown". That would never happen in a real professional football game, but in Family Guy, anything goes.Overall I think this is a great show for young and old adults. There is something in Family Guy for everybody. Its hilarious and unpredictable humor makes it an enjoyable show to watch. When the fourth season came out on DVD, Star Magazine said the show was "As rude and funny as it ever was!" I simply can't agree more with their blurb. As for myself, I think Family Guy is one of the funniest and most entertaining shows ever made.

OK I'm a huge fan of the first 5 seasons, but after that I cringe with absolute disgust. Seth was going pretty good until he got lazy and pathetic with so called reality he so humbly describes his satire/ real life work. You might find one good joke every 4 episodes, but it's a lot less then what Seth could poo out every episode. The only good quality left is Stewie, he is the only character left that I might chuckle at, everyone else (yes including Peter) is an absolute embarrassment to the senses. I'm sorry if Seth chooses gross out gags over smart satirical gags to appease to the huddle masses of Generation Y. Yes I gave it a 8/10 that's how good the first 5 seasons were, the rest is just pig vomit that a once funny guy now finds acceptable.

Let's not deny it, Family Guy was once a huge hit. I would watch every episode and buy all the box sets, but recently it's been lagging in both storyline and character development, and not to mention the fun factor.The story is about the Griffin family, Peter is the overweight, drunk and retarded dad who gets into all kinds of crazy get ups, like his hilarious plastic surgery addiction, and getting America jumping into song and dance in the infamous Shipoopi number. He is married to the extremely attractive and feisty redhead Lois, who comes from a very wealthy family. She is a loving mother, but is also a dynamite in the bedroom. They have three children, socially rejected and unattractive Meg, Chris, the preteen Peter, and violently evil baby Stewie, who craves world domination and conducts bizarre schemes to kill his mother. And last is Brian, their talking pet dog, who drinks, smokes and does drugs, whilst maintaining unsuccessful relationships with various women and tries fruitlessly to complete his novel.Sounds pretty good, right? Dubbed by many as the 'adult Simpsons' and I happily agreed. But the arrival of season six brought the well known 'Stewie Kills Lois/Lois Kills Stewie' two part episode which saw the downfall of the once great evil Stewie. That annoyed me, but I still enjoyed the series, but after another season I became bored with it. What started as a great, hilarious cartoon about a dysfunctional family suddenly turned into a violent South Park remake, complete with swearing and gore.I still like some of the episodes such as 'I Dream Of Jesus' and 'Road To The North Pole', but the characters have viciously transformed way too much. Peter is now less comic drunk and more violent drunk, where he beats everyone up and swears until he turns blue. Lois is now, well, insane. Still full of the sex jokes and raging libido, but it's become rather tasteless and annoying. Meg is also violent and tries to become the boss of the family with gross outcomes, but is always shoved back down the social ladder, where she continues to cut herself and throw up. I preferred her as the sweet girl who gets on with her family, despite all the crap she gets. Chris is still the preteen Peter, and I just don't like it. Stewie, like I said, has shed his evil persona and become a normal baby, besides all the high tech gadgets he possesses, although he occasionally finds himself aiming a gun at Lois. Now Brian? I never liked him much, but now I loath him. He drives me nuts with his selfish personality and urge to legalise drugs, whilst every so often tries to rape Lois, who he has a deep unrequited love for. Oh, and he falls in love every other episode, but it never works out.Yes, it sounds like I hate Family Guy now, but I don't. It still produces some funny episodes and memorable themes, but all in all, I don't like the characters or the over use of blood and swearing. The new HD isn't doing it for me either, I preferred the previous animations.Some will love it, some will hate it, it all depends on what you like. I still watch the episodes in hope that it will restore the greatness it once had, but for now? Fail.

In January of 1999, we were introduced to the Griffins. A rural Irish family just trying to make it from day to day. I fell in love with their first show, and watched the series all the time. The humor was on time. The pop culture references were dead on, and the cut away jokes were smart and used in the best way. The stories had some emotion to it too. The characters would come to some realization, and it would make them have a greater understanding, or would bring some of the family members closer together. The characters were lovable. First you had Peter Griffin, the lovable but stupid father who just wanted the best for his family. His wife Lois tries to hold the family together whenever Peter has another hair brained scheme. Then you have their three children. The oldest daughter is Meg, a social outcast at school who just wants to be accepted by the cool kids. Chris is their middle son who is kind of slow, and is only interested in drawing. Their youngest son Stewie wishes to rule the world someday, and wants to see death come to his own mother Louis. Then there is the family dog Brian, a sophisticated talking dog who does his best to guide Peter through his life.The show was canceled after a couple of seasons, and naturally fans were upset. It finally would make it's way back on to television. However it was never the same, and it hasn't gotten better as the series has progressed. It no longer seems to be about the stories anymore. There is no positive emotion to it. In fact, the show has gotten cruel over the years. Most of the jokes they do now are just flat out mean. There is a fine line between being funny and then being cruel, and they cross it a lot. They use cut away jokes way too often now as well to the point it has gotten old and repetitive. They also seam to work too hard to set up a joke as well, and by the time the joke happens, it is not funny because you are expecting it. The character development has a taken an odd turn as well. Stewie seems to have given up on his quest for world domination, and instead spends his time hat shopping. Though not as often, Stewie still tries to kill Louis from time to time. Peter is no longer a lovable idiot anymore. Now most of the stuff he does is just annoying. It seems that MacFarlane having to work on three shows at the same time has put a strain on the series. Family Guy is still a popular show on T.V., and will probably stay there for quite some time. Will it be around as long as The Simpsons, I don't know. It might not since Seth MacFarlane is busy creating other shows, and he may get tired of Family Guy. However, if you are someone who has never seen the show, I recommended seeing it from 1999 and early 2000's

I used to love Family Guy. I loved the fact that Seth MacFarlane pulled no punches. No one, and no topic, was off limits. Seth wasn't afraid to make fun of every religion, every ethnicity, every stereotype, ever political view and every social topic. But....that is no longer the case. Seth is now a cancel culture loving coward afraid to hurt anyone's little feelings or say something that might cause the Twitter mobs to get outraged. Today's Family Guy is watered down , unfunny shell of what it used to be.

I just love it! It's a great cartoon, that I hope sticks around for a long time. It's comical and witty, and goofy, like if Airplane or Naked Gun was animated. Most people might think it's just plain stupid, but there is a lot of wit to it, and a lot of jokes that can be missed, references to commercials and takes on TV and movies (Like the Critic, which I miss a lot) One example was when Peter was in the bank with robbers, the run goes off, and they cut to this kid, exclaiming that he just bought a JFK pez dispenser, which naturally gets shot. Another was when the German sausage vender, who looks like Hitler, takes control over the Polish both, then glances over at the Chechz's booth, and even the Mento's (Minto's parody they did as well). there is a lot of things, that is as crazy as Simpsons, and a lot of parodies to movies, and al ot of quick one liners, such as "I'm sorry Timmy, you need 15 tickets to live" It's also the side stories or flashbacks, that happen when a character makes reference to some event. I find this show funny and clever, and do wish it would stick around, showing that Fox is just as outrageous as ever. :)I think this, with Simpson's, Sunday's 8 o'clock hour is one hilarious stitch after another. God bless those folks at Fox :)

It's just not the show it was ten years ago. Personally, I think Seth MacFarlane has too much on his plate with this show, "American Dad", and "The Cleveland Show".The most annoying thing is how painfully repetitive the story lines are and those that aren't, aren't even funny. James Woods, the chicken fights, Spies Like Us, etc were not funny at all.MacFarlane and staff seem to follow the same plot points every episode and it's unbearable to watch anymore.Peter, Joe, and Quaqmire scheme something. Check. Brian and Stewie scheme something. Check. Random references to a movie or some click from the 70's or 80's. Check. Meg relays how pathetic she is. Check.I think MacFarlane tried too hard to over take "The Simpsons" but his show was never as good. I love "The Simpsons" and I'll be the first to admit that the last ten seasons aren't even close to being as good as the first ten. However at least Matt Groening puts out something different with each episode.

Family Guy, where do I begin? This show can make me laugh more times in 1/5 of an episode than most "Emmy winning" shows can make me laugh in their entirety. The jokes are not only frequent, they are hilarious and genius. From the voice acting to the writing this show has everything I've ever looked for in a sitcom. This show has seen me through my worst times made me laugh even when I didn't think I could. Seth please never listen to these snobby critics and easily offended people with no sense of humor. What you have made is the perfect comedy, and you've made my life so much brighter.

family guy review When family guy first aired in 1999 it was brilliant all the jokes were so funny and always a blast to hear,but seasons 1-4 are amazing,unfortunately season's 4-9 are just terrible nearly all of the jokes are offensive and sick,i think that Seth macfarlane ran out of funny jokes so just threw in stuff that just did not work at all. some of the jokes do cross the line,and are truly shocking.Not for the easily offended,or people with a weak stomach,as in every series there is always a lot of violence,blood and vomiting.Seth macfarlane also created American Dad a side splitting animated comedy about a CIA family man who is always on the lookout for terrorism,if viewers are offended by family guy then i suggest you check out American Dad as it is a lot of more acceptable jokes. my rating is 5/10

Good show! It's very hilarious. The character of Peter Griffin is so good. You can't hate this show. The irony of the society is very well presented here. The jokes are very good, maybe sometimes to good and who can't taste the them, don't have humor. And the fact that is at season 15 means that the viewers are happy with the show. Recommend it!

I didn't warm up to FAMILY GUY right away, even with (or perhaps because of) my two teenage daughters pestering me to watch it and calling it the funniest show on TV, along with FUTURAMA, which I definitely could take or leave. Then I happened to watch the episode where the family heads down South. I could not stop laughing. I was not only laughing but in tears. No SIMPSONS episode, no SEINFELD episode, no ODD COUPLE episode, no MASH episode was ever this side-splittingly funny. I then saw the episode where Peter installs a fully stocked bar in his basement, and Lois becomes a sexy chanteuse. Simply amazing. I now watch the show every chance I get. And you should too. Worse comes to worse, maybe you don't have cable, you can always pick up the entire series on DVD now.

I'm glad another season and a movie are being made but come on, this show should have been given at least a 5-season run from the get go. It's one of the funniest shows on TV and reminds so fondly of the best years of the Simpsons. Seth McFarlane and his writers come up with some truly hilarious stuff and Peter and Stewie are two of the funniest characters on TV next to Homer Simpson.It absolutely sucks that Fox put this show through the wringer, but now the people have spoken (over 100 000 of them) and we'll be getting more Family Guy. Damn right?

Well, after seeing more and more of these newer episodes, I just have to say that they feel energetic and more clever. The reviewers that are saying Family Guy sucks now are just probably looking for something good to dis. Family Guy did not plummet after Season 4, or even Season 8 for that matter. These newer episodes have so far had good plots, with a few good sight gags. They have definitely improved themselves, because they want these negative reviewers to stop talking bad about this show and see it for what it really is, clever gags and hilarious comedy, I mean yes they do have an excessive amount of musical numbers which everyone loathes. But, this time they've cut back on them this time. Anyway, these last three or four episodes have done much better than any other episode. Soon Family Guy will get the movie treatment, and that'll be fun to watch. With the amount of improvement they've made since the negative reviewers dissed them too much, I'm glad. And if these people keep dissing them I don't know what they'll pull. Face it you negative review writing jerks, Family Guy won't end, not this time (at least until Seth MacFarlene dies). So stop making pointless reviews that are obviously just because you want to dis something successful. Still 10/10 stars!

Some may think this is a Simpsons, but I don't care. It's a funny show. That keeps you laughing so hard you would not know when to stop. It's unperdictable humor makes it amusing to watch. It's a shame it got cancelled, but I'm glad it's finding a new audience on DVD and Cartoon Network. It's the funniest cartoon show for adults since The Simpsons. You may laugh ten times harder with this show. Seth MacFarlane is a talented genius, when he created this show. And has talented voice training, when he does the voice of Peter Griffin, Stewie Griffin, and Brian(the dog)Griffin. His talent in that because all of those voices sound nothing alike. I hope there will be a Family Guy movie!

Compared to what this show used to be, this is just awful. Just like the Simpsons (Only worse), this is a show that didn't know how to quit while it was ahead. So, while early Family Guy episodes were gold, the modern ones are some of the worst episodes of shows I've ever seen. Most of them are gross-outs or blood baths.

I'm told that the line quoted above has been changed for the third season to "...laugh and cry." Never mind, either way it holds true.Seth MacFarlane's good work on the first season of "Johnny Bravo" (and the Cartoon Network's "Larry and Steve," which also featured a talking dog) continues on this series which, though patterned closely on "The Simpsons," has the redeeming feature of often being very funny, although a good knowledge of American pop culture is a plus in getting some of the jokes. (Fortunately, I'm a lifelong Yancophile.)Not much story in each episode, just lots of jokes - but good ones, however. And it's interesting that unlike Homer Simpson, Peter's genes have been noticeably passed onto his children (both Chris and Meg are decidedly plump). That's the only way it is superior to we-all-know-what, though - it's not as layered or as rewarding. All it is, is very very funny... but is that so bad? Er, no.And you've gotta love that Stewie.

The Simpsons were great and were the show of the 90's (Especially from 92-99) but after a while, Matt Groening and his crew of writers began running out of Ideas.YKW I'm thinkin'. This is the only cartoon that i have ever consistently laughed at unlike The Simpsons which has 5 episodes in a row that totally suck then it may be funny sporadically. Is violence in movies and sex on TV!  Well here you see sex on TV but not the violence.  Family Guy is a surreal comedy created for FOX on late night procedures.  Unlike the Simpsons in which the show was spawned from, Family Guy relies on surreal jokes to keep it fresh.  From Peter Griffin's flashbacks, to the surreal in-jokes from quotes.  Then there's Stewie, the psycho-maniac baby whom carries the show on his little body, and Brian the Dog with his sarcastic commentary.  Even if it doesn't have the flare and ingenuity of the Simpsons, it still is okay...

I started watching this show when it first came on in 1999. I have never missed an episode and watching this show is the best part of my week. My week can be awful, but after an episode of FAMILY GUY, I don't care anymore since I'm too busy laughing at what I have just watched. There are many rip-offs of this show [such as BABY BLUES and HOME MOVIES], some of them are good and some of them are pretty bad. However, none of them are not nearly as funny as FAMILY GUY. FAMILY GUY is a one of a kind show. The voices are perfect, the jokes are sharp and witty, the writing is superb, the story lines are extremely clever, and the theme song is so catchy I spend half the week trying to get it out of my head. Some people may call it a 'Simpsons' clone, but the truth is that this is far different than THE SIMPSONS and a lot better too. I don't think there will ever be another show as original as FAMILY GUY.

Family Guy would have to be my favourite T.V Series for the reasons below I am about to display.It is outrageously funny but I may warn you the humour Family Guy displays is very crude. If you are in the mood for a laugh or got nothing to do I would definitely suggest it.Each episode of Family Guy is different. As they go on different adventures or need to solve another problem one of the family member is having.My favourite character is Stewie. A baby who is as smart as a grown male. His best friend in the family is the dog called Brian. They will often set out on crazy and strange adventures that have a twisted yet awesome ending. Stewie is a very unique child because he has attempted to kill his mother (Lois) in many different episodes.The reason I gave Family Guy a 9/10 and I know this may sound harsh but some of the things that the characters say can be taken as offensive or racist and another reason is because of an episode entitled "Life of Brian" but I won't go into to much detail with that.Seth McFarland (the creator of Family Guy) has made an outrageously funny and creative show that is a big credit to him. And i do not mean that a purely "bad" character is a bad thing. Especially the character of Peper Griffin switches from prinicpled and caring to reckless and downright moronic - a little too much. In Simpsons ... there usually way a reason for Homers behaviour... in Family Guy - there is not.In Family Guy - i realized that i was watching an animated version of the Kardashians after a while... or rather - a show about a bunch of utmost idiotic people - that never learn a thing and do not develop.And whats the fun of that ...To be fair - some scenes and jokes hit the mark and the show does know how to be funny - but the infuriating setup of it all ruined it for me.So all in all ... it is just average. Why did they have to cancel this show?  This was like The Simpsons with attitude!  I loved this show!  It was like a South Park that was suitable for broadcast TV.  It pushed the limits, but not to the point of protest. It was flat out funny, if stupid. These shows will always be compared to The Simpsons, since that was the first really good animated satire made for television. Some really good ones, like South Park and Futurama has come along since then, but The Simpsons is still the original. The creators of these shows know this, so the shows that pop up have different ways of attacking society. Futurama, for instance, does it from a futuristic point of view, and South Park is almost a bit political at times, but they are both GREAT shows.I haven's missed an episode of Family Guy, and I just love the show. It's just really brilliant, and Stewie is one of the funniest and most evil characters I've seen in years. All character (except maybe Meg) are brilliant, and I love them all. This shows angle on society is television, and it does a really good job at ridiculing it. No show is left untouched, and they have just started.One BIG part of Family Guy is the flashbacks. They are absolutely incredible. My favorite is "I remember the last time I accepted a coupon from a man in a chicken suit". They are so insane and wonderful that you just want to keep them in your pocket and take them out on special events to show your friends (the flashbacks).Well, just enjoy the show, I know I will. Yeay Seth MacFarlane!!"Must kill Abraham Lincoln..."

SPOILERSI know, Family Guy is a rip off of the Simpsons. Peter is just like Homer. Lois is just like Marge. But, Chris is not like Bart at all. Meg is not like Lisa at all. Brian is not like Santa's Little Helper at all. Stewie is not like Maggie at all. Also, Family Guy's humor is not like the Simpsons at all. The Simpsons is just like a real family. It has some things that would never happen, but overall it's a very realistic cartoon. Family Guy, on the other hand, has silly humor that it could happen, but it would be very odd if it did happen. Family Guy also consists of flash-backs or recurring gags, like the Evil Monkey that lives in Chris's bedroom. But mostly, it's just Peter's wacky flash-backs.Family Guy has a story just like the Simpsons. A regular, suburban family are in wacky, silly situations. The thing is, Family Guy's situations are much wackier, and unrealistic. For example, a family could go on a reality show, in an episode of the Simpsons. Family Guy, on the other hand, consists of a talking dog and talking baby going to Europe. See, Family Guy is not really realistic. Although it unrealistic, it's a good show throughout, with all the movie parodies and wacky plots.Overall, this is a great show, although it can never be as good as the Simpsons. I also find Family Guy's humor very original, which I liked. Also, some things can be pretty offensive.8/10 Recommend Titles: The Simpsons, South Park

at least I hope it doesn't. I liked the first episode okay but the last couple episodes... The dog and baby are the best things about it and they're both ripped from other cartoons. The baby bent on world domination... can you say "Pinky & The Brain"? and isn't that the Dilbert dog?

Smart, near to the knuckle, but usually very funny show that won me over with the abundance of clever 'in' jokes, usually through the use of 'flashback' scenes.Best episodes are in the 3rd series, especially my favourite where they end up in the deep south and mercilessly parody life in those parts.Well observed characters, with excellent voices (esp Stewie's evil Rex Harrison voice) make this well worth watching. Plenty of interesting 'guest' voices pop up also.However if you are easily offended Family Guy is best avoided,they're not shy of pushing the limits of good taste.

Family guy in its hay day was a decent watch. Sure the plots were thin, but there was definitely a lot of heart put in to the characters and jokes. This results in one of the best shows to watch in a group
However when we fast forward, modern family is easily in my top 10 worst shows of all time. This show rotted very fast and went from good to downright abysmal. The jokes for the most part are unbearable and usually are done for filler. The plots aren't just thin but desperate for shock, like Stevie and brian having puppies and Peter marrying Chris
If you're planning on watching this show watch seasons 1-9. Seasons 6-9 aren't the best and still have bad episodes but they are still watchable

Pros: Stewie-Best T.V. baby I've ever seen. When I watch the reruns of the first few seasons, I look forward to another moment of Stewie.Early series-I admit, this show wouldn't get less than seven stars from me if the quality of the original show was kept up.Open-ended universe-ANYTHING can happen in the Family Guy universe. It's fun to think of all the pure outrageousness around.Brian as a talking dog-If dogs could talk in dog situations, like being chased by the vacuum or car-rides, I think McFarlane and the boys have captured in perfectly.Occasional Moments- One out of every ten of the cut away jokes are actually funny.Cons: Peter, Lois, Chris, and Meg-Except for the obvious differences in appearance and minor tweaks in personality, these characters are VERY similar to the Simpsons. A stupid, oafish, over-weight dad, a usual moral mom with an annoying, naggy voice, a dumb, trouble-making son, and an often sad, unpopular daughter.Brian as a person-Annoying, usual unfunny, and often ruining the greatest character on the show.Stewie/Brian Tag Team Episodes-Cheesy, crappy episodes. In my opinion, they should put Peter and Stewie together more often.The Evil Monkey-It gets real old, real fast. Like the first time you see it.The Fighting Chicken-It gets real old, real fast. Like the first time you see it.Use of Dead Celebrities-I mean dead figuratively. Half of the time, the stars they use in their cut aways are people I have never heard of.Pointlessness-This is why many people find this show annoying. Nine out of ten times, the jokes come out of NOWHERE!!! One such joke was when they showed a married caveman couple arguing. For five minutes of my life that I'll never get back, I felt confused and annoyed. For a better idea of what I really think of Family Guy, refer to the South Park episodes "Cartoon Wars" parts one and two.

Peter is the dad in the griffin family, he is the funniest in the family, Lois is a house wife and teaches piano, Brian is the family dog who is anthropomorphic, Stewie is the baby who is somehow evil and extremely intelligent, Chris is Peter's son and in many ways like his father, and Meg is the daughter who doesn't fit in school and is constantly ignored and made fun of in the family.The quality of Family Guy is 100,000 times better than any Family Guy spin off.
