Family Guy is total Bushlea

For everything that Family Guy is (funny, sharp, fresh, creative, outrageous), perhaps the most important aspect of it is that it has done things that no other show in the history of television has done.Family Guy is the only show to be resurrected the way it will be in 2005. It was cancelled (most say unfairly) by Fox, only to continue expanding its audience via basic cable broadcasts and a devout cult following. It is one of the first shows to make a huge financial impact with DVD $ales, hitting huge financial heights for any television show, especially a cancelled one.But that's not all. The Cartoon Network broadcast of banned episode "When You Wish Upon A Weinstein" in November of 2003 was the first (and to my knowledge, only) time that a cable program has beat out one of the big three networks (ABC, NBC, CBS).The show will be brought back to FOX sometime in early 2005. Although fan support played an integral role in the return of this show, that fan support would not exist if the product they love was not of such high quality.Seth MacFarlane and Family Guy have persevered and made it a long way not by gimmicks or luck or a sweet timeslot. They made it on something that so many television shows lack: quality. Family Guy is simply a creative and funny show that might be the biggest cult favorite of all time. When it makes its re-debut in 2005, one can only imagine that Fox will have a gigantic hit as the legions of die-hard fans tune in, as well as the casual viewer who just wants to see what all the fuss is about. Family Guy may very well be the show that usurps The Simpsons as the Fox network's ratings juggernaut.All riiiight!

Family Guy is one of those shows that people like because it is funny, and very easy to follow. This makes the show boring to me because it is so simplistic. The humor is pretty much random which is funny but it becomes so predictable after a couple of episodes. The show focuses way too much on flash backs and references, and not enough on plot. An episode can contain tons of jokes, but nothing will happen, nothing is accomplished, and the characters don't change. This is what makes American Dad superior to Family Guy. American Dad actually has characters who learn, change, and evolve.The way the plots are set up are rather annoying. I feel like the development of an episode starts with the jokes and then ends with the plot. Truthfully, the plot of each episode is garbage. There are a couple of good episodes here and there but rarely are there any amazing episodes. As far as animation goes, Family Guy is extremely simplistic. Most of the shots/angles are all from a side angle. This means that there are A LOT of reused animations, reused scenes, and a lot of recycled material. It makes the animation come off as lazy and uninspired. All of the characters in Family Guy are awful. Chris is annoying and kind of selfish, Peter is insanely stupid and just so stupid that I cannot like him one bit, Meg is just annoying and I just wish she could be more likable, Lois is just annoying, Stewie may be the only likable character because he is smart, witty, and a bit more creative. Brian is cool sometimes, but he contradicts himself all the time so it is unbearable to listen to him. Overall the entire family is annoying except for Stewie. This makes me not care for any of the characters at all, which makes all of the stories not interesting. Another annoying aspect of the show is that the family members treat each other as room mates instead of as family. This is something Seth Mac does frequently in his shows and humor. I understand that the family is supposed to be dysfunctional, but in Family Guy none of the family members even seem to like each other in the slightest and they treat each other more as acquaintances.I admit that the show can be funny at times, but the lack of plot, character development, good animation, and good characters makes it rather unbearable to watch. All of the characters are jerks, all of them are selfish, and all of them are annoying.

Before I start my review of the show itself let me say that I first watched Family Guy while season 3 was airing in the UK and stopped watching at season 12. I used to regard myself as a huge fan of the the show but times change...Let me say right off the bat I think seasons 1-6 still hold up well and I give them a solid 8/10 but seasons since then have slowly decreased in quality with the odd good episode (I will leave a list of episodes I feel are worth watching after season 6 at the end.)The show follows the Griffin family and co. on wacky adventures and cutaway gags. Nowadays the cutaway gags seem overused and the stories seems to be running out of ideas.The characters and colourful and the humour is tasteless but done fairly well (when it isn't shoving political opinions down your throat). When the show is doing stupid but wacky humour is when it is at it's best in my opinion.The turn for the show in my mind truly turning from good to bad is the episode 'Family Heirs' which features multiple incest jokes to the point where the episode revolves around it.As I said earlier in my review, here is a list of episode I believe are worth a watch that aired after season 6:The Star Wars Parody Trilogy; Believe it or not, Joe's Walking on Air; Stewie kills Lois/ Lois Kills Stewie; The Man with Two Brians ;Road to Multiverse; The Splendid Source ;And Then There Were Fewer; Road to the North Pole; The Big Band Theory; Back to the Pilot; Family Guy Viewer Mail 2; Yug Ylimaf.

Right off the bat, its unconventional, got a lot of toilet humor, can be crass and often insensitive. Your typical Simpson fan might call it uncultured and an eye sore. But once you are past its first appearance, its actually really hilarious and in my opinion way better than the Simpsons. It caters to an adult crowd, while targeting the child within us. That bratty, arrogant and fussy child. Honestly speaking its the only show on right now, which manages to give a few laughs. Sadly shows like Bobs Burgers and American Dad are becoming evermore placid. If you are a South park fan this will be right up your alley. Finally for the artistic nuanced crowd, Seth MacFarlane manages to give glimpses of his sheer genius by giving odes to really popular pop/culture/political references, and just like the Simpsons, many real life stars have actually given voice to their characters.

Family Guy is the hit 1998 show that continues to make the audience laugh. Now, like with the Simpsons I am going to rate the separate seasons because they all derserve a different rating's.Season 1: Excellent, showed lots of charisma in this series, a lot more stuff about what family's actually do then compared to other seasons of the show. I rate this season 75% Season 2: The show was getting really good by here and it seemed like the show was building with every episode. This season deserves a slod 83% Season 3: Best Season yet, show was using cut away gags to a minumem and the plots were getting funnier and funnier. This season gets 93% Season 4: Started to get a little carried away with the cut away gags in this season. This is probably the worst season in the show's history. I give it 69%.Season 5: Despite getting incredibly ridiculous with the cut away gags this season was a lot funnier then Season 4. The show was holding on to a certain thing called wit. I rate this season 77%.Season 6: 2nd best season, funny used gags well, cleverly constructed episodes instead of just throwing together some rubbish. I rate this season 91%.Overall: 81.33%

It's painfully obvious that the writers of Family Guy have run out of ideas for the show. Season 14 is an absolute flop and should have never been published, it would have been better to end the series at season 13 which was already in the throes of death. At least I wouldn't have been as disillusioned as I now am. I had originally rated this show 10 stars, but with season 14 I'm lowering it to 8 stars.

Family Guy is the funniest animated show around easily, with the exception of The Simpsons. It was witty, creative and just a stroke of genius, I tend to laugh out loud a lot during one episode, which is more than I can say about most other American programs.But I have to say, I don't care for the most recent series. I was mostly disappointed that some of the characters changed; Stewie seems to be less cynical in newer episodes and that was what made him a great character in the first place. And as for Peter, in my opinion, the funniest character in the show, has become less stupid and his lines are more offensive than offensively funny. The show's writers seem to think now that the shock factor appeals more than genuinely funny dialogue.As for other disappointments, the 150th episode was just a waste of time. Watching a extra long episode of Stewie and Brian in a vault was so pointless, I don't think I laughed once in that episode. And as for the spin-off, The Cleveland Show proved to be nothing like its predecessor.Over all, Family Guy writers need to pen better humour if they don't want the show cancelled for the third time.

Quite a few people insist that Family Guy is a rip-off of The Simpsons- it isn't. Sure, the whole dysfunctional family thing is incredibly similar to The Simpsons, and they ripped off quite a few jokes, but the style of comedy is generally different. Family Guy uses flashbacks and side-references, generally to effect.And yes, Family Guy can be stupid- but it's funny, isn't it?My favorite characters are without a doubt the diabolical Stewie and Peter (although the talking family dog comes close).A very funny show that doesn't deserve to be labeled as a pale imitation of The Simpsons as it has. Check it out.

I don't know why people are criticizing this amazing show. It still is and will continue to be one of the greatest show and not only in my opinion but to many others as well. It's humor and unique characters stands out and unlike any other boring cartoons I can actually remember some of the most outstanding episodes from season 1-12. Still a little improvement couldn't hurt... For me I have seen many other adult shows and many of them are either too inappropriate or to boring. And to those who consider canceling the show, you are 1 of 1,000,000 people who think otherwise. Anything can happen with family guy from surprising jokes that make me laugh to memorable moments that no other show has. Keep up the good work and continue the legacy!!!!

FOX is living up (down?) to it's reputation with this show. If you like mean-spirited, low-brow cynicism, you'll like the show. That kind of humour has never been to my taste, however. Dead on right when it's compared to 'Married With Children', above. I'd thought that kind of cheap-shot, groaner humour died with the previous show. I should say, I'd hoped. Still, I have the right to turn it off, and I do.

if i could've rated this a 0 i would have. this show is a string of stupid, nonsensical jokes that don't even follow the plot - and i use that term loosely in this case. it's not even worth being called offensive because it's too idiotic to be so. forget about the re-release...it never should have aired in the first place. doing something for shock value alone does not make it edgy or clever. it just makes it juvenile. bottom line is that every episode i've seen (aka: been forced to watch by my 13 year old nephew) made me want to pummel the creator. again, i use that term loosely. don't waste your time or brain cells.

Family Guy is like that annoying friend in your social circle. They are often unfunny, immature, and even malicious, and yet, you still come back to them anyway. You keep being friends. That is my relationship with Peter, Lois, The Griffin Kids, and the other minor characters in this controversial cartoon. The only thing that continues to piss me off beyond end is Brian Griffin, who is possibly the worst cartoon character ever created. Some say that Family Guy jumped the shark after his death, but for me, Brian's sweet demise brought me back into the show, despite Brian's replacement being bland to say the least. 6/10, would run Brian over again.

Fantastic show! In many ways it reminds me of The Simpsons - the way the family is structured; a father of lesser intellect (to say the least) and a daughter with all the intellect the father is missing. A sensible mother and a son always looking for a fun time....sounds familiar?Well, it doesn't matter! Family Guy stands for itself as a fantastic show, as said earlier, a bit like Simpsons - buuuut....slightly more rude and more sexual undertones ;-)At the writing moment it only reached three seasons, and I sincerely wonder why....however, rumours talk about a feature film and more episodes in the future.....so I'll be looking forward to that tremendously...

Family Guy is definitely one of the funniest shows ever. I liked its "Homicide: Life On Sesame Street" thing, and the Kool-Aid guy jumping in and shouting "OH YEAH!!!", and the parody of the old Mickey Mouse cartoons ("Peter And Brian in Fixin' The Shed"), and there have been many cool things on that show and I can't name 'em all. Yet, I think there should be more characters on the show. But I don't think there's gonna be any character better than Stewie. Stewie is definitely the best. STEWIE FOR LIFE!!! (Brian and Peter are also funny).Anyway, if you like The Simpsons, you'll like Family Guy, 'cause it's BETTER!!! (Don't get me wrong, The Simpsons is a cool show too, but Family Guy rules!).

This show even though seems like a rip off of the Simpsons, often times it does better. Seth Mac Farlane made the characters much dumber then the Simpsons or South Park to make it funnier. And I love the 80's pop culture references. Seth MacFarlane is a genius, and I don't just say that because he's from my home state of Connecticut. I give it a 9 instead of a 10 for several reasons. I'm normally not offended easily but sometimes the show goes too far. Like when they say Stewie played MArco Polo with Helen Keller, they show him swimming in the pool saying "Marco...Marco" I thought that was just terrible. Or the time when Peter's father says something to Brian who's not Christian. Brian said "Thats very Christian, believe what I say or i'll hurt you." then Grandpa Griffin hits Brian with a rolling pin over the head. I'm not the best or most devoted Christian in the world but I still found it offensive. Other then that...good show.

I wonder when people will realize that it is shows like this that desensitizes teenagers to misogyny, racism, mistreatment of the handicapped,LGBT ... need I go on? Making fun of a girl with Down Syndrome in order to make a commentary about Palin. Wow, Fox Animated ( or whoever does the writing)! Is your ingenuity and creativity boundless? It takes a clever mind to kill three birds with one stone- showcasing your political opinions, being sexist, and attacking people for a quality with which they were born all at the same time. It literally blows my mind that people are puzzled by why boys make sexual remarks that destroy girls' self esteem. Parents give lengthy discussions on how Disney channel shows promote lying and dating, but then let their tweens watch this nonsense. This show is NOT intended for any audience under 18

this show was surprisingly good. me and my brother are in love w/ it. a lot of people say that peters so stupid and they cant stand such an ugly American, but face it. there are a lot of people like that. not EXACTLY like that, but pretty much. there's the dopey dad(peter), the wife that teaches piano lessons(lois),the baby w/ the cockney accent(stewie), the nerdy daughter(meg), and my favorite, chris. where is this familiar? hmmm,lets see. a fat dad, a normal wife, a nerdy daughter, and a son just like the dad and w/ a talking dog and baby. i guarantee if you like the simpsons you'll like family guy. i personally like it WAY better.

I watch family guy every day and love everything about it. When I cannot sleep the whole show keeps me going till I fall asleep. I hope the show will continue for many Yeats to come. Thanks for all the laughs. I really love the way all the characters in someway relate to parts of my life growing up in Massachusetts. Meg reminds me a little of my sister, and Lois reminds me of my mom who I lost early in life. I love Peter who I can relate to myself sometimes getting into all kinds of trouble. And as far as Meg goes,I sometimes can relate to her in many ways. During my school days, I was not very popular and like Meg found it hard to be accepted. All in all I will continue watching as long as the show continues to air..

This is a really funny serise but it only has fifty episodes.now lets get to the caracters,peter he's the main guy he dose really funny and wired stuff.lois his wife the daugter of a rich jerk who hates peter she's really funny too.chris he's sort of slow and dose not have alot of episodes about him.meg the only daughter and my least favorite character she's cold and mean and annoying.brian the talking dog and peters friend dose not get a longe well with stwie,stwie the talking baby who is always trying to knock off lois.this is a great seris its too bad fox screwed arounde with it also it has some dark humor and abrubt endings.This is a good seris defenily reccomended.

This could possibly be the funniest TV show I have ever seen. I never miss an episode. With characters like Peter Griffin and the riotously funny things he does, you can't afford to miss a second of this. Other characters such as Louis, the little voice in Peters head that says "dont do it" but he never listens, and Stewie with his cant-do attitude towards other people and his snappy diabolical comments make them some of the best. Along with Chris the tubby, lovable son and Meg the sixteen year old "i want to fit in" daughter you just can't go wrong with this show. You have to be crazy to not love the Griffen Family! Seth McFarlane is a comical genius!!!!!!

Jimbo has seen this show and it was Hilarius. voice of Peter Griffen, Stewie Griffen, and Tom Tucker was Hilarius. Alex Borstein as the voice of of Lois Griffen was cute. Seth Green as the voice of Chris Griffen was historical. Mila Kunis as the voice of Meg Griffen was wonderful. Whats Hilarius that Peter Griffen says in Wheel of Fourtune "Z, 4, Q, twice Q, Third Q and a Batman simble" and the final answer "ALEX KARRAS in WEBSTER". Whats also Hilarius that Peter Griffen says "How much for that fat guy in the circle there is no price tag". This show is Hilarius you will laugh hysterical for watching this show except when Peter Griffen and Lois Griffen having sex in the office.

Family Guy was a cartoon that delayed in the late '90s on FOX, andwas instantly one of the most talked-about TV shows around.Some people called it too controversial and it was boycotted bysome religious groups, and FOX canceled it two or three yearslater. What puzzles me is that there was the same controversysurrounding The Simpsons when it first aired, and FOX stuck withit and didn't let it go, and it became a major phenomonon. PerhapsFamily Guy could have become the same kind of thing. Family Guy is a hilarious show that appeals to intelligent peopleand average people alike. It's got some gross out humour, somewickedly funny one-liners and the best flashback scenes. Theanimation is sharp and better than other cartoons, as the peoplelook real. Family Guy is still majorly popular, and you can catch it around9pm on Teletoon.

I had avoided this show for a long time, because in preview it looked like it would be a lame rip off of the Simpsons.  Boy was I wrong.Superficially it looks very Simpson-like (animated family, two older kids, dog) but the construction of the plot lines is vastly different.  I love the use of flashbacks and the little oppositions set up (the parents talking about worrying about the kids wholesome development while dressing up for a session of S&M)It is absolutely hilarious, and absolutely NOT for kids.  I'm pretty sure that's why it wasn't so successful on FOX (do they work the word penis into every episode?).  That and they kept playing musical time slots.Now, however, Cartoon Network is showing it in their Adult Swim lineup, and I understand it is their highest rated show. It's on late at night when the kiddies are in bed, and in a place people tune in to watch adult oriented animation.  It doesn't hurt being on right after Futurama (another excellent show that Fox time slotted into oblivion) either.

This is one of the best animated series ever. It is a shame that they banned it in Poland.Anyway, for some reason people always try to compare it with other cartoons like "The Simpsons" or "South Park", it isn't fair so just chill out and give it a chance. I think that "Family Guy" should be good show for Monty Python's fans, because it contains a lot of satire and absurdity humor. Oh and i don't know where people can find this cartoon racist. It's not! They even make jokes about racists, rednecks, but also about people too touchy on racism. So, if you are unprejudiced, and loose enough to not be offended by political incorrect jokes, you will love "Family Guy".

Family Guy is the funniest cartoon ever. It's the only programme that makes me laugh out loud every time I watch it. Peter Griffin is the most hilarious character in any TV series. Family Guy is better than the Simpson's's because it is much funnier. The Simpson's's ran out of ideas years ago, Family Guy is still fresh.I love how random this show is. I love the fact that Brian is a talking dog, yet none of the other characters think this is odd. My favourite character is Stewie. I've never been sure if the others can understand him, but that's all part of the humour. I love his attempts to take over the world.Family Guy should be prescribed by doctors for anyone who is depressed. If you don't laugh at it then you must have chronic depression.

This is one awesome show, and here are the reasons why. First, there are random scenarios episode after episode. Second, the series has dozens of popular culture. For example, in the episode, "I dream of Jesus", Peter rediscovers his favorite song of all time: Surfin' Bird. I have been inspired to love Surfin' Bird and drive my family crazy with it. The first time I have watched an entire episode of Family Guy, was when I was eleven, and I was totally hooked on it, even though it's vulgar, it's funny! What else I love best about Family Guy is that it even did the Star Wars Trilogy, and I totally loved it!! The most hilarious episode would be "The Splendid Source", where it involves Peter laughing at a dirty joke so hard, he poops his pants. Every time that happened, I burst out laughing so loudly, my parents could hear me all the way upstairs, because I was in the basement.

The first time I saw this show, I laughed so hard and long Imissedhalf the jokes. They don't play it anymore now, but it was greatwhen they did. The show is about a fat guy and his kids. Episodesinclude when they're at war with the country and when the little guytravels into fat guy's body

I remember wanting to watch this in the animation craze of 1998 when every network were airing at least seven animated shows; all failed.Unfortunately Family Guy was one of the ones that failed; a cartoon too clever for its own good.While watching this, this was a sharp edgy and witty cartoon, I realized that this is incredibly funny, maybe funnier than my favorite show of all time "The Simpsons."One guarantee is, "The Simpsons" never made me cringe nor has it ever made me gasp with wide eyed disbelief before. Inevitably deemed too contreversial the show was yanked off the air and found new life in cable reruns becoming so popular FOX network decided to begin airing new episodes."Family Guy" is sometimes so clever and witty and funny; and sometimes it's too witty. It's pop culture references and on the mark jabs at politics, ethnic stereotypes, and social issues seem too smart, almost too good to be true.This is practically what would be referred to as a perfect animated adult cartoon. It's characters are three dimensional with personality galore and wit to boot. Like many of the British sitcoms, the characters featured in here are so despicable and unlikable you end up loving them, and this show never pulls its punches.It doesn't ask to be liked, and when there's a huge guest star on the show it never makes a big deal.Just when you think the show is about to get sentimental it turns around and completely kicks you up the rear with one cringe inducing hilarious pun and joke after the other.No one is safe from "Family Guy's" radar as it jabs at every fad, craze, television show, celebrity, social issue, stereotype, ethnicity, and politician living or dead.There are many sharp edges that will upset a viewer and there's plenty of rapid fire unrelenting jokes in each episode to upset at least one viewer.There's pokes at abortion, slavery, politicians, murderers, criminals, and every television show and movie ever made and it's all so funny. Of course you have to have some knowledge of pop culture to understand the jokes.There's plenty of clever episodes including (my favorite) when the character Peter fakes his death and is being stalked by death who literally comes knocking at his door to take him into the afterlife and after he breaks a leg chasing Peter, the family does everything they can to keep Death stalled.Of course that episode is childs play compared to other episodes. The cast of characters and excellent voice work is what make this show so funny to watch. There's an alcoholic neglective father, a passive house wife, a daughter desperate to be popular, a simple minded large son, a talking walking booze junkie house dog and even a psychotic newborn baby intent on killing his mother, his worst enemy.At times this show may make you cringe, it may make you groan, it will offend someone eventually, but it will surely make you laugh out loud.

Well! I can honestly say I've given Family Guy many tries. I tried watching it.. I just don't see what everybody else sees. All my friends put Family Guy in their "Favourite shows" list, and finally I decided to see what all the talk was about! It was stupid. They take the lamest things and try to pass it off as rude or witty, and it's not! I watched it and the whole time I was giving it the are-you-kidding-me look! It's not funny! The baby has a nasty voice, looks really ugly, and till I asked somebody, I didn't even know if anybody else could understand what he said. Like in Rugrats, nobody understood what they said! How was I to know this was any different? My opinion is just that it's not half as great as shows like The Simpsons that allude to so many great things out there and turn it into disgustingly funny or witty or subtle! Sometimes you may even go "Hey I know what they're talking about"! But with this show, there is nothing there. The humour is dull and weak, and incomparable to other shows I enjoy. Example, Friends. What a hilarious show with REAL actors! I just find this such a rip-off show, and no wonder it's been canceled like 3 times? Hope all you viewers out there stop the conforming and open your eyes to better entertainment! GET THIS SHOW OUTTA HERE!

Family Guy.....what can i say? It can be funny and stupid. The shows characters, Peter Griffin- the fat dad. Lois Griffin- stay at home mom Stewie Griffin- baby who wants Lois to die. Megan Griffin- the girl that everyone hates. Chris Griffin- the fat kid, who'll probably be in every relation to Peter someday. But he's a nice kid. Brian- the talking dog.Some may compare Family Guy to the Simpsons. It's hard to compare a show that has been around for twice as long as the other. (Simpsons- 20 years, Family Guy- 9 or 10 years depending on if they've made any new episodes recently) However, since the plots are similar, people do compare.Some of the Family Guy episodes have definitely made me laugh, hard. With those that were funny, there came the ones that were, eh. The humor used in Family Guy is not quite as low key as the Simpsons. The humor is more open because Family Guy is mainly directed toward +14 yrs old. They can mix and mash, doesn't matter. With the Simpsons, you're more limited with the jokes because kids as young as 9 or 10 watch it.Family Guy isn't really put together good when it comes to characters. A surprise could come to you in any episode, which is good and bad. The Simpsons was well thought out when making the characters. Even though both of these family's are your typical American family(not including the talking dog and the talking baby.) Back when most of the Family Guy episodes were funny, I would watch repeats over and over. Not even thinking about the Simpsons. Getting sick of these repeats and waiting very impatiently for some new episodes. When I found out that a new episode was coming, I promised myself I would watch it. When it came around, I was disappointed. That's when the show pretty much went down hill and I hardly ever watch it now. Unless it's repeats from older episodes. The Simpsons pretty much has gone through this but also comes up in some episodes.I wouldn't say I like one better than the other because they are both unique in there own way. Both have had there ups and downs.older episodes of Family Guy- 8/10 newer episodes- of Family Guy- 3/10

This is a funny show if you're old enough, young enough, while knowledgeable enough to appreciate it and understand it. Younger viewers born throughout the majority of the 80s won't understand many of the pop culture references dealing with TV shows of the time or even childhood in jokes. Baby Boomers as well will be mostly confused. Even the difference between me born in 1978 and somebody born in 1982, is a pretty big cultural gap. I think this is destined to be a cult show that only a certain era or generation of people can truly enjoy. That it's scheduled Thursday nights at 8:00 in the fall against both "Survivor" and "Friends" either means one of two things: cancellation or UPN.

I liked the simpsons then i started to watch family guy and should say it is totally a copy of the simpsons. The character of the baby is really disgusting. How they think it's funny! They tried to design a baby like Maggie but this baby is really annoying.

This is a show that has copped a lot of flak for being unoriginal and unfavourably similar to 'The Simpsons'. Ironically, that criticism itself is now quite unoriginal. True, creator Seth Macfarlane and co. couldn't come up with an original storyline to save themselves. But look back at some of 'The Simpsons'' best episodes and you'll find that they aren't entirely original either, with whole story lines dedicated to parodying films like 'Cape Fear,' 'Animal House,' 'Pulp Fiction,' and 'Rear Window'. Matter of fact, 'Family Guy' is a satire that is at its best when it is, to put it bluntly, directly lifting material and poking fun at it.My main problem with 'Family Guy' is that Seth MacFarlane can often come off sounding pompous, and because he overrates himself as a singer, he never misses a chance to stroke his ego by injecting an overblown big-band musical number. But then he throws in a well-measured 'giggidy-giggidy' and all is gladly forgiven.

This show started out brilliantly, it really did, and there are still a few good episodes, but the show has shown its age, and it is rotten and senile. For one thing, its edginess is a double edged sword. It can be used to great measure, such as attacking faith healing, promoting stem cell research, and issues such as living in an abusive relationship. However, sometimes this backfires, as some messages are biased, poorly executed, or even wrong and harmful. And in later episodes, the show becomes flat-out sadistic on a human centipedian level. We get treated to: boring plots, needlessly long cutaway gags that are irrelevant, scenes of Conway twitty that last up to 3-4 minutes, that are just there to kill time since the writers cannot make a plot to fill in 22 minutes, and at this point, pretty much every character has done something amoral, even the ones you are supposed to like. You know you have created a twisted universe when the nicest character is the rapist quagmire.I'd actually not mind if the show stuck to being mean-spirited, peter griffin being violent and psychopathic is funny, making him similar to wario. What bothers me is that you're supposed to side with him. The man who abuses his daughter for not being aesthetically pleasing, murders people, and doesn't care about his family, has certain scenes that try to make him seem likable when he really isn't. Please, just keep him as a villain or anti-hero, and stop pretending he s an excusable human being. It'll just be a better story if you keep him as a bad guy.

Now everyone is saying this but why did FOX cancel this show.  It's probably the most hilarious show on FOX....well the funniest cartoon because That 70's Show is the shiznit but thats besides the point.  What I love about Family Guy is that in every episode you'll see  something something that's going to make you laugh your ass off for about 5 minutes.  So far I've read all the reviews of tv goers on the site and they love it....maybe 3% hate it and the rest love it. To get you to laugh, you have think like an idiot and believe me...I have no problem with it.  It's what the industry, and I want to be politically incorrect, calls stupid funny.  Damn you FOX, shame on you.  That's why cartoon network rules.  They always play the cancelled cartoon shows.10/10

In the simpsons: Homer seems to capture our hearts with his extra-ordinary stupidity. Family Guy introduces a new element: believable stupidity. Everything you ever wanted to do but thought 'nah thats stupid' represents the life of Peter Griffin. And with a family of babies, dogs & kids with their own problems and the poor Lois trying desperately to bind them - you got a winner. Every gone up an escalator and wanted to push the red stop button? On one episode the dog questions peters will power and refers to a time where peter was set next to the emergency exit on a plane and saw a red button that activated the exit (while the plane was mid flight). he glances at the button and away from it a dozen times and then slams it - everyone in the plane gets sucked through this tiny exit mid flight - it makes me laugh so much! The characters are mixed into a world that intricately mocks reality and questions the behaviour of celebrities we all know when forced to interact with these bizarre people.
Family Guy gets compared to the Simpsons just because they're both animated shows?  FG isn't the next Simpsons; it's the next Married With Children.

Considering the fact that FOX basically has jack besides the simpsons anyway "and that show is falling fast" it is really hard to understand why FOX keeps cancelling this show when it by far the best thing they have going for them.  The show's wit is unmatched by anything except for Frasier on NBC. Stewie's massive vocabulary and facial expressions make him one of the most classic characters i have ever seen and this show only has 40 some odd episodes.  And i hear arguments saying that the characters haven't been developed, but cmon EVERY character on this show has their own unique brand of comedy.  Something that you can't say for other animated shows like "The Simpsons" or "Futurama" (honestly i think that show sucks anyway).   I like the fact that FOX has decided to put the show on primetime on thursday at 8pm, but that will mean it won't get the ratings that it should due to "Friends" and "Survivor."  I think they should just scratch King of the Hill or any of their other shows for that matter put this AWESOME show where it can be seen by everyone.  If this is done, this show will be by far the best show of this decade.

Peter and his dysfunctional family are back on Fox for their fourth season, and believe it or not, this first episode of the season was probably one of the funniest of any episodes.Seth MacFarlane and his fellow writers did a great job parodying the Passion of the Christ in this episode. "North by North Quahog" revolves around Peter and Lois' going on a second honeymoon to get the spark back into their marriage (since Lois keeps having fantasies about George Clooney.) They wind up using Mel Gibon's suite in New York, and they caught.MacFarlane's signature cutaways are still intact, and in fact many of the side-skits were a bit longer this time. The voices are surprisingly still well done, with the exception of Seth Green's character Chris occasionally falling out of his voice. But, we can expect that to pick up with the later episodes.Overall the second coming of Family Guy appears to be just as good, if not better than before. Die-hard fans will be pleased.

I've given a similar review for South Park - Family guy does a great job or pushing the boundaries of humour but fails to ultimately fails to be accurate. It's intent seems to offend more than entertain.

Me And My Friends Enjoy Watching This Show. I've Been Watching This Since January. My Favorite Characters Are Peter And Stewie. In This Show There Is A Dog Named Brian That Drinks Alcohol With His Best Friend Peter. On An Episode Of Family Guy I Found Out That Lois Smoked Cigarettes When She Was Pregnant With Stewie. That's Why Stewie's Evil. Peter's Best Invention Is Mr. Zucchini Head. He Works For Mr. Jonathan Weed At Happy Go Lucky Toys.

We travel to fictional Quahog, Rhode Island, home of fat, drunken buffoon Peter Griffin, sultry wife Lois, dumb, but kind-hearted son Chris, teenage drama queen Meg, Stewie, the British-sounding baby bent on world domination, and Brian, the dog; the dog that talks sophisticated, drinks sophisticated...Almost every episode is hilarious, and creator Seth MacFarlane does not hesitate to add celebrities committing acts of, let's say, unusual doings, (Luke Perry as Adam West's homosexual bed-mate, Keanu Reeves as a brain-dead washout) but that does not interfere with the intelligence and consistent humor of a show somehow always teetering on the brink of cancellation. Controversial acts that add to the hilarity include the kidnapping of the former pontiff, (JP2, RIP) among many others. VERY ENJOYABLE, NOT TIRED.

Family Guy certainly is a outstanding show with genius jokes and a bunch of quotable moments. Seth really puts one hell of an effect in these episodes he puts out!! There were even some heart-felted moments that made the show even more enjoyable to watch! Yeah! It's that good! But this show main problem is that most of that was in it's early seasons. Later seasons have became seriously more violent and more ridiculous than ever before! There are no insightful jokes but more of just randomness that goes against some of Family Guy's origins that made it good in the first place! I know not everyone is going to agree with me on this but the show has already passed it prime! It needs to end!

I know this is a relatively new show on TV, considering shows like the simpsons, but it is one of my favs now. The show does seem to take things from other shows and the flashbacks do get a bit annoying, but it makes up for it with good old retard humor. A lot of people don't like this show because it is VERY racist and has a lot of sexual humor, but people need to learn to laugh at themselves sometimes. Shows like this will be remembered by certain scenes off the show, like Peter singing can't touch me. Don't know why so many people complain, I think that's the reason there is a channel button on the remote. My opinion is this show is great, many many laughs off it, hoping for many more to come, a kind of new simpsons for people older than 10. One of the few shows I enjoy on TV, and hope they start showing it more than twice a month. Don't judge before you watch at least 3 episodes, promise you'll laugh a few times.

I am from England, and the show is not that well-publicised or much-shown over here, so I didn't pick it up until the third series. Before that point I thought that no cartoon could live up to the standards set by The Simpsons, but I was mistaken.I got the Season 3 box-set ASAP and watched it within a day. I then got the first two series. By this point I had heard the news that a fourth series was in production and I was delighted. The first few episodes look fantastic, and I can't wait to get them all over here.This is no rip-off of any other show. It is original, hilarious and controversial in its own way. 10/10

It was really good. When Stewies kills the vaudeville guys, it was a moment for the real fans. For some reason the writers had this hard-on for vaudeville that was never really explained. It's still not explained but it is very well addressed. I think there was some other good stuff too. They want more lines in this so i will fill it in with the following: It seems today that all you see is violence in movies and sex on TV. But where are those good old fashioned values on which we can rely? Lucky there's a Family Guy. Lucky there's a man who absolutely can do, all the things that makes us laugh and cry. OK they still want some more lines. I thought that song was longer. I guess they just repeat the same thing over and over. I also like how Brian is basically a person but he had his distinct "dog" characteristics. Example: dragging his ass on the carpet, chasing the tennis ball and being fooled when Lois throws it, being afraid of the vacuum cleaner. These are all very nice juxtapositions put forth by the show.

My, my. This series is over 20 years old. And I review it now, no matter.This series is supreme Comedy that everyone should watch. The best of the best, even though Simpsons is good, this hits the first place BY FAR.The show anyhow, is about a Family, A stupid Dad, a smart wife, a stupid son, an ugly(?!??) daughter, a drinking dog and a baby Who wants to kill his mother, such adorableness. Usually, the episode is about Peter screwing something up, Stewie and Brian 'venturing around in time, Chris being scared of a monkey in the wardrobe or Meg being bullied by her family and school. Ah, sounds like such greatness, doesn't it? And songs, ah, the songs, are supreme as well. A Bag of Weed, Shipoopi, Give up the Toad now, The Rose, All I Want for Christmas, Down-Syndrome Girl, Wonderful day for pie, Bird is the word or The Spirit of Massachusetts is probably not even a tenth of all the songs through out the series.If you have not, in some absolute ridiculous weird way haven't watched this show in one way or another, you must've lived somewhere isolated, really. Watch it, now. *People goes watch the pilot*VICTORY IS MINE!...All I want for Christmaaaaas...

Anything that can happen will happen in this cartoon. I watch this cartoon everyday. If you dont laugh at this cartoon your stupid and you should be hit with rocks and sticks. Peter is the funniest. He does stuff you would never think of. This is me when watching Family Guy, HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAHAHHAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHA,because its that funny.Rating: Ten Thumbs Up

The jokes are lame. Not entertaining at all.
Explanation scenes are completely redundant.

I love Family guy so much i want to keep this brief, Fox you had a sure fire hit on your hands you could have made so much money.  Everyone loves Family Guy so why only 3 series!?  It was the funniest thing i have seen in a long time.  Sure the episode "One if by clam, Two if by sea" offended me a little because i am English, and that most of the things said about us wasn't very accurate or funny but you have to sometimes sit back and just laugh at yourself.  This is probably why it was axed because it offended to many people but damn it, it was funny!Sorry to see you leave Family Guy, i look forward to the movie.  (lets hope it can get you a couple more series!)

On it's original run (Seasons 1-3) the show is an 8 out of 10. Now this is pure garbage. This is on season 12, and it hasn't been canceled yet, it's filled with horrible, random Cut-Away gags, Time Fillers and more bad stuff to waste your f***ing time. The DVD's are pointlessly uncensored, despite the lack of real nudity and bleeped swearing. I get sick on how many times i'm hearing "Giggity" everywhere, this stupid euphemism for "That's what she said" is dumb. I'm baffled that this has an 8.4 on IMDb, while Home Movies has a 7.7, I don't get it, Home Movies is WAY better than this sh*t. Peter is a rip- off of Homer Simpson, not in a subtle way, it's blandly obvious. The world could be a better place if they just cancel Family Guy, and bring back Futurama, that being said, if you want to get into a good series, watch Futurama, even in it's bad episodes, it still stands funny, American Dad is also recommended.Overall, American Dad is better, Family guy gets a 4/10

The simpsons really are getting a little boring, despite excellent efforts from the writers. FG's real competition, is Futurama. It is obvious from looking at early pilots of FG that MacFarlane didn't get nearly as much leech with FG and Matt Groening got with Futurama. But the only character that really suffered is Peter. Don't get me wrong, he's fun.. He's not very un-origional. And while Futurama does not have any really un-origional characters, the just don't have any as colorful as FG. I'm thinking of Stewie and Brian ofcourse. Stewie really is a classic. Diabolical little genious, future leader of the world, mocking people while they change his diaper "Yeeesss.. You like cleaning my poo don't you??" Brian too though, a synical, well-read snob, and full blown alcoholic. Meg really is what she is in the show... Boring. But she does do it well :) There isn't much to say about Lois either. It's a close race, but I supose FG's warped humor just really appeals to me.

I can't remember the last time a cartoon made me laugh with such utter vulgarity and craziness!! Where do I begin?? I think that makes the show are the flashbacks. This isn't a show that leaves a lot to the imagination, it SPELLS EVERYTHING OUT for you, which is hilarious. For example, Peter makes a comment that he didn't fart until he was 18. Then we see a flashback of a younger Peter, and we hear a fart and Peter looks around and says, "what the hell was that??" BRILLIANT!! Also, the tv anchors Tom and Diane are hysterical. If only local news had more people like them!! Quagmire is my favorite character, and I laugh every time he says "giggidy giggidy giggidy!" Also, the Evil Monkey in Chris' closet is the best!As funny as this show is, it is definetely not for kiddies. There are some times when I have been boarderline offended, and I am NOT one who is prudish. One example of this show pushing the envelope is when he is asked to babysit for the Griffin children, Quagmire sites Megan's Law as the reason why he can't do it. That's just creepy. But then he babysits anyway!! Shocking stuff.As many times as they make my jaw drop, these characters can also sing and dance!! I'm a huge musical theatre fan, So I LOVE when they spoof different shows. Epsecially the episode where Peter becomes the theatre director, and he keeps changing everything around. When Lois expresses her dissaproval at all his rewrites ,Peter says "I thought you wanted a good show! if you wanted to do a bad show, we would have just done RENT!" this made me laugh espesially hard, because RENT is my favorite musical ever =)Well, i've babbled on long enough. I would just like to end with saying, Seth is a comic genius!!!

I have never really got into another cartoon show, until I'd seen the previews of this show!  I watched it when it came on after the Super Bowl, and I laughed 'till I choked!  I say, this is one of the _funniest_ cartoon sit-coms ever!  I can't wait for it to become a regular show when it comes to FOX!I think this show is better than the lunacy of The Simpsons, Beavis and Butthead, and South Park, those are shows I don't like anyway.  My favorite parts were when Peter tried to contact his angel good side and the angel was in the middle of the traffic jam!!!!!  LOL!!!!  And the Kool-Aid man bit crashing into the courthouse, classic!!!  The characters are funny, too, you got the fat, lazy Dad, the son who's just like him.  A morbid, and depressed teenage daughter, a disapproving Mother, a homicidal baby, and a talking dog whose the only sane member of the Griffin family.  ;-)Let's hope Family Guy becomes a popular show!!!!!

What more can you say about Family Guy other than it replaces the Simpsons as the flagship of animated mass-market (non-cable) prime time entertainment. This is not a knock to the Simpsons- they have been and still are shaping the landscape with their innovative writing. Family Guy has pushed the envelope past good taste, common sensibility, and even adherence to 30 minute sitcom guidelines.The rough skeleton of the show serves as a superstructure for comedy bits which would be impossible to segue to otherwise. The illogical jumpiness of the main plots (Which are sometimes thin) to the gutbusting asides is the focus of many of the series' critics. I can only ask that those watching the series critically to get past this- suspension of sitcom guidelines is essential to enjoyment of Family Guy.It's not "The Simpsons", and it's not "Everybody Loves Raymond" (thank God). It's Seth McFarland's masterpiece, and if you don't take it seriously, it's really darned funny.

This has got to be my all-time favorite show!, i noticed a lot of people have been comparing it to the Simpsons but this show is in a league of its own! I personally don't find the Simpson's very funny at all, but this show is guaranteed to have me in stitches at least three times every episode. My favorite characters are Stewie, the Mayor of Quahog,"someone's stealing my water", and Chris who i believe deserves much more air time but every time he appears on the screen i practically wet myself laughing. I bought a box set of this not expecting much as i hadn't seen much of it but i was addicted and have watched it many times over. I have lent it to all my friends and every time someone brings up this show we all quote our favorite lines because this show is 'classic'. I live in Australia and i am very annoyed at Channel 7 for taking this off the air and putting it on at very late time slots. Anyways, if you have not had the pleasure of viewing this show yet then do as it is gold and i just want to take this opportunity to give my congrats to Seth Mc Farlene for creating this piece of genius!

Here's a case of revisionist assessment of a television show wherein people grow fond and soft and warm towards something that was 'unjustly' maligned and received poor ratings then got canceled (ie Twin Peaks).Make no mistake: this show sucked when it was on and it will suck now and forever.  It takes more than a succession of pop-culture references to qualify as 'humor'.Don't let this show become thought of as one of those 'brilliant, canceled gems'.  It is not. It is crap. Bad jokes, bad drawings, bad voices, and bad, bad ideas.

The first 2-3 seasons were ok... Never utterly hilarious, but good for a few laughs. It hits on some topics that are quite boring, and some of the gags go on way too long; for example, when Peter falls and hits his knee or whatever, he moans forever. The video cutscenes are super annoying and also go on far too long. It's almost like they needed fillers.
It's gone downhill after about midway through its run, I suppose. I just don't laugh anymore.. it's just not funny enough to keep me tuned in. Some of the skits and overall theme of many episodes are boring.It's ultimately forgettable and doesn't hold a candle to some other animated series like Beavis and Butthead, Simpsons and King of the Hill, which are all far better than Family Guy.

I have to thank my wife to be to introduce me to this show in the UK. In fact - I don't even know if it ever aired here but thanks to Series 1-2 being available on DVD - I have been watching them.It combines the cartoon skills of the Simpsons with the anarchic edge of 'South Park' - without going over the top on gross humour. It is hard to see why anyone would like the oafish, insensitive and culturally uninterested Pete - but it works very well. What are liked about the show was it 'fantasy trips' when someonementions a subject - and you see the main characters in that situation. And it doesn't have the 'let's be cute' approach that I think always lurks around in the Simpsons. So my advice to fellow Brits - if you cannot find this show - ask a friend in Canada or USA to get you send a DVD set of the 'Family Guy' thisChristmas !

Family Guy is, without a doubt, one of the funniest shows ever to grace the small screen.  The show itself is an animated masterpiece that doesn't often rely on the old gimmicks of situation comedy.  It is as irreverent to as many subjects as possible.  Another element that truly aids in the show's hilarity are the many obscure references to movies like Tron and show's like "The Facts of Life."The ensemble cast is stellar and all are perfect for the characters they are voicing.  The creator, Seth Macfarlaine, does many of the character voices including Stewie, the tyrannical baby with plans for world dominion; Brian, the sarcastic and alcoholic family dog; and the family guy himself, Peter Griffin, who gets into more trouble than any man should.  Alex Borstein does a fine job voicing the family mother, Lois Griffin.  She also voices many of the female stock characters such as news anchor Diane Simmons, Asian reporter Tricia Takanawa, as well as many others.  Seth Green's rendition of Chris Griffin, son of Peter and Lois, is hilarious and perfectly suited to him.  Mila Kunis did the voice of ultra-reject daughter and sister, Meg Griffin.The show also featured a fabulous group of guest stars which includes Adam West, all of Kiss, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Bob Barker, Candice Bergen, Ed McMahon, Kelly Ripa, and Wallace Shawn.Overall, the show was a comic masterpiece and was cancelled far too soon.

Among the many problems is the father's constant bad behavior, mostly his complete lack of manners, He beats up everybody all the time, He kills people and the Cops just let him go so easily. "That is so BS".I must say I have to agree with some other reviewers here - Peter does and says lots of bad things, His voice is so nasally and Annoying much as his Wife Lois. Basically, Peter never cares about her until the end in Every episode this was a complete waste of time. I really Hate Peter the Mean Spirited, Fouled Mouth, & Childish Father. His Main Catchphrase is "Da**it", he said it in almost every episode & I hate that word. It really bothers me & become very I'll Tempered and have Temper Tantrums and also break people's things. This is why Family Guy is a Bad Influence on Kids & Adult with Disabilities.This show is nothing but annoying. I don't know why it was created, and I don't know a single person who claims to like the show. It teaches the audiences to be rude, disrespectful, act violent, & Racist.

**DEFINITE SPOILERS AHEAD**Some people have referred to this as part of the brilliant tradition of the Simpsons, but they couldn't be further from the truth. "The Simpsons" has (usually) been a brilliant parody of the flaws of modern U.S. society, mocking our wan acceptance of mediocrity, cleverly criticizing the unfairness of the U.S. economic system, and generally critiquing the remnants of racism, sexism, anti-Semitism, and homophobia which still taint our society. "The Family Guy" is the reverse."The Family Guy" imitates the taboo-breaking humor of Y2K comedy to camouflage its reactionary stance.Skeptical? Take a look at the episode attacking gun control.The way Peter Griffin's family treats him is the reactionary right's ideal of male privilege: he can be completely selfish, self-absorbed, violent, outright cruel to his children, and yet he is still treated as the head of the family For No Other Reason Than He Is The Father/Husband. This is not a good-hearted man who stumbles; this is an argument that merely being male is sufficient justification to dominate all others.Lois Griffin is the reactionary right's ideal woman. No matter how much her husband puts himself before her, she remains loyal to him. She has no sense of identity beyond her roles of mother and wife. In one episode she took on feminism to promote stay-at-home-mom subservient wife values.Stewie Griffin fits perfectly with the Dobson explanation of children. Read the Focus on the Family propaganda and you will encounter the steadfast belief that children are born evil and an eerie return of the Victorian belief that the evil must be beaten out of them. Thus Stewie promotes the idea that there are no innocent children, justifying the reactionary right's delight in corporal punishment of those younger and weaker than the average adult.The Griffin family solution to almost everything involves violence and a distrust of outsiders. Peter happily beats up anyone who disagrees with him. Sometimes innocent bystanders are killed off for a laugh, but as long as that person is not a member of the family, no one cares.I could continue, but I think I have made my point."The Simpsons" is the sort of program which points out to us how we need to improve ourselves."The Family Guy" is the sort of program which rationalizes excuses to remain just as lowly as we are at our worst.

I've been following Family Guy ever since it first aired and like many others was angry at FOX for canceling it in 2002. At the time, Family Guy was unique because it blended pop culture from yesterday and today due in part to its cutaway gags. When it returned three years later, it hadn't lost its edge and was still funny as ever.However, the show began to lose its focus in the following seasons; I guess you can say that was when the new material settled in. The writer's strike back in 2007 further damaged the show. After the strike ended, the show became stale and even gut-wrenching at times instead of downright hilarious. It's now come to the point where I don't devote my time to watching the show anymore for a variety of reasons.The main reason I seldom watch Family Guy is because it's become too politically preachy. It has delved into some controversial topics that were improperly handled (i.e. revisiting the Terri Schiavo incident which happened five years before the episode aired). While most satirical shows criticize the left and the right, Seth MacFarlane only evangelizes his own beliefs, meaning he only argues for one point and against another. This is what American Dad is for, not this show.I prefer the characters back when they weren't fully developed; now Peter acts and is looked down upon like a whiny five-year old, Meg is constantly treated like crap, Brian is the preaching atheist, etc. The fact that Seth has a carbon copy characters on every show he has (Devoted but absent-minded father, driven-to-the-brink-of-insanity housewife, teenage daughter who's trying to fit in, socially awkward son, at least one talking animal or young child, etc.) also makes me question his creativity. It's also become obvious that he purposely wrote Cleveland out of the show in a desperate attempt to get black people to like him (I'm white and I think The Cleveland Show a disgrace; not just to blacks but to rednecks as well).Bottom line: Family Guy was in its prime in its original run and for the first season of the return.

FAMILY GUY IS THE FRIGGIN BEST SHOW ON TELEVISION, THE WHOLE THING IS PERFECT! Seth MacFarlane is one of the greatest minds to hit television, and I'm so glad he did. He took funny to a new level, knowing full well that he was not limited by the laws of human nature with an animated series. He knew EXACTLY what it meant to have an animated serious. It meant he could do ANYTHING he wanted to with it. The show is quick witted, fast as lightening, jokes come from everywhere and they are all so perfectly timed and well organized. Some people say this show is dirty, filthy, blasphemous and racist...well you're damn right it is but there is not ONE thing that these guys left out to make fun of. They tackle every race, every religion, every celebrity, every potty joke, every sex joke, they get it all, so I think that by being SO racist as to make fun of everyone, they aren't really racist...see where I'm going? huh? It's OK, you don't have to. This show is the best. Laugh at yourself to you're bound to feel insulted in some way. Funniest show ever.

Jokes against religious groups should be frowned upon. They don't know when to draw the line. They have also lost their touch over the years; it's not as good as it used to be. Watching bobs burgers instead.

This is one of the funniest shows to be on primetime television.  No, sorry, THE funniest show on primetime.  Sure, The Simpsons have their moments, but they're diffinantly getting old.  It's nice to have some fresh, new jokes. Funny ones, too.  Seth MacFarlane has created an animation masterpiece.  Now don't mess it up...

Family guy was never really anything above average, but these recent seasons, good god what happened.Like the shows gone from pretty average to absolute rubbish with these recent seasons.It's just so boring, all the jokes boil down to either, reference or racist stereotypes, yes Seth I do know what back to the future is, oh my god Seth what if Marty was black, what if, what a revelation, you truly are a comedy genius mr McFarlne, you truly are.

Okay yes this show can be laugh out loud funny at times but as someone who sat through every episode that has aired to this date I can't say I even like the show. Sure there can be a good even great joke every episode or 2 but sometimes there is none. Also almost every single character becomes assholes as they're worst traits are only heightened with the shows run time. Sure I did for the most part enjoy the very early seasons of the show but they definitely still had issues with characters among other things but the show gets worse and worse even though I see very small improvement in more recent episodes. Not to mention when this show tries to be serious anytime after the first couple seasons it falls flat on its face and it's almost insulting. This show overuses jokes and ideas as well. I could go on and on but to conclude I don't recommend this show unless you maybe have a good episode guide to tell you some good episodes or if you're just looking for a rare laugh or you're with your buddies because that can make it a lot more bearable.

If Family Guy offends you or you simply don't get the humor, unfortunately this show is making fun of you and the masses of overly religious, dull, and politically correct people in America. So put your morals aside and have fun with this show. FG is a hilarious mind opener on the reality of today's society. Whoever said this show is for a young immature audience is very mistaken. With all the references to old movies and politics 10-80 years ago, I couldn't imagine any young immature kid finding this funny. Family Guy is definitely for a mature open-minded audience who are not afraid to criticize American society. Hats off to Seth and the whole crew who were able to make this show happen.

The Shark is just waiting to be jumped.Leave it to Fox to cancel the show while it was still good. That's always been the pattern of many really good shows. Brought back with the help of a strong fanbase, Family Guy should have stuck to the original formula that had made it funny. True, it was raunchy, it was scandalous, it was blasphemous. But it was tight, and that's what made it work.Now, Family Guy's problem is they think they can get away with anything. It's what I like to call the "dictator effect." Bear with me. In their early stages, a dictator's reign is often on thin ice, but they often initially want to help their people. But as they solidify their standing, they'll consolidate power until it would be a death sentence to criticize them. Family Guy is no different.Comedy is comedy, but you reach a certain point where it ceases to be this way. Family Guy has replaced jokes like "did you know Jesus and Moses used guns to fight the Romans?" with "I have Down's Syndrome and my mom is Governor of Alaska." If the writers of Family Guy are trying to make a political or social statement, they go about it the wrong way. The best jokes about pop culture are being replaced with the worst jokes about abuse, abortion, homosexuality.I do enjoy most of the pop culture references on the show, especially when I've observed what they're trying to convey. Who thought Liam Neeson's American accent was awful? I did, and I'm glad to know Family Guy did too. But it's losing its touch. If Dennis Miller was being tortured into doing a show, that is what Family Guy is like now. The awkward jokes that drag on for a minute or more are just awful. We understand that the music video for Dacing in the Street was gay, but do you have to show the whole video just to prove your point? In the sense of the bigger picture, Family Guy is the prime example of the declining value of comedy in today's society. We have lowered our expectations, and so we get this. Comedy used to be about a good punchline and careful observation. Now it almost brings a tear to my eye to see what has happened. Look at those Comedy Central roasts they do. If you want to see what comedy is really about, look up the Dean Martin roasts on youtube or watch Sinbad. But now? Vagina? I just booked me a spot on the Tonight Show. Sex? I'm winning me a Mark Twain Prize! In conclusion, Family Guy is still a pretty good show. Not great, but not as bad as some of the other shows out there. But those writers need to get their act together. No doubt they were going to hell for presenting such blasphemous material. But now they can't go with a smile knowing that it was still funny. Instead, they have only their regret to contemplate.

This is the best show. It's so stupid that it makes you laugh and laugh. Peter and his family are the weirdest family ever and the jokes are a lot risker than the Simpson's comedy. This makes it a different kind of entertainment. This is one of the best cartoon shows ever.

My favorite episode was the one in which Joe, the man in the wheel chair, entered the special opympics, or whatever it was, to prove that he was still a man.  I don't think that this episode, overall, is better than the others, but I choose this as my favorite simply because of the scene with the reporters giving their intro to the games.I thought it was crazy funny when the male reporter was saying how we just might have a good laugh at their expense and the female reporter says, "Oh, I know I'll be laughing," to which the male reporter replies, "Yes, after this is over, I'm sure we'll all be going straight to hell."  Of course, I'm paraphrasing here, but that scene was just evil and hilarious.My favorite quote, if I got it right, is when Peter tries to escape from Death by running away from him and Death calls out to him, in a laughably unimpressed tone, "If I could catch Flo-Jo, I can catch you!", Flo-Jo being the Olympic track star who had died recently as of the first airing of that episode.  Again, evil and hilarious.

Now that Stewie the Baby can travel back in time to save Brian from death, the writers should be capitalizing on a South Park Style "Kenny/Brian," series of horrible, disgusting, mutilations of Brian being repeatedly killed. Then Stewie just hops in the time machine to bring him back.This is a missed opportunity to indulge in "black" humor, that Brian the Dog could be mashed, mangled, shredded, and horribly destroyed, but still return to continue the episodes.I only give the show a 7, as it is not using its potential.

The premiere episode was very funny, witty, sharp.  The second episode, though, fell thoroughly flat.  The third episode got off to a good start, but fizzled halfway through.  Here's hoping the writers hit their stride

Family Guy is by far the funniest show that ever graced television (and when I say funniest I am saying that FG is funnier than South Park, Simpsons, and Beavis and Butthead). This show is everything that the Simpsons want to be. I believe that Seth MacFarlane [creator of FG] has created a way funnier show than Groening's Simpsons. Unlike Simpsons, Family Guy is actually funny. The show's clever jokes never get old and Peter Griffin has dethroned Homer Simpson.Personally, I think Matt Groening saw that Family Guy was a way better show that his outdated Simpsons. I almost certain he had a hand in the cancellation of this great show. It won't matter when Family Guy gets revived by either FOX, Cartoon Network, UPN, or Comedy Central. Then Groening can kiss his beloved Simpsons good-bye.

When I saw the first episode of Family Guy, I was literally rolling on the floor in laughter after the Kool-Aid man scene from that episode.  I then spent the next week trying desperately not to burst into laughter again. Family Guy does something that few cartoons do, it doesn't necessarily focus on plot or character development every episode, instead it tries it's hardest to make the viewer burst into laughter harder than ever before. Never before has a cartoon tried this before.  The gags are so subtle that you will literally never see them coming, and went they do arrive, they burst into the scene and leave you breathless from laughter (the flashback scenes this show did were classics).  The humour is much more adult, but not to Beavis & Butt-Head or South Park levels, it's just enough to appeal to older viewers.  I am so angry that FOX didn't see the true potential that this show displayed week-after-week, they instead pushed it around and cancelled it repeatedly.

Everyone should go pick up the Family Guy Volume 2 DVD to support the show. I know that a lot of people were surprised by how well Volume 1 sold, and were blown away by the ratings for the show when it began its run on the Cartoon Network. So you never know what might happen if Volume 2 sells well. I mean, the DVD is already the #1 seller on Amazon.com, and the shows been cancelled for how long now? I think the Family Guys cult following is prompted FOX to let the creators of Family Guy go into production for a Family Guy Movie, which will see light in a year to a year and a half. So until then, we should all just pick up the Family Guy Volume 2 DVD to keep ourselves busy, and support the show!

Family guy is about the Griffin family, which consists of Peter, the idiotic but generally well intentioned father figure. Lois, the sexy and sometimes abusive yet most level headed house wife. Brian, the intellectual self-loathing dog of the Griffins. Stewie, the once evil hell bent on world domination baby later turned gay. Meg, the well-intentioned but black sheep daughter of Peter and Lois. Chris, the under educated but spirited son of Peter and Lois.Much of Family Guy is based on the shenanigans of Peter and the grief they cause his family and friends, though often times his family and friends are involved in his shenanigans.Family Guy more often than not goes' for offensive humor, often times making light of very serious situations such as Rape and Murder. This is in fact to offensive for some, but I personally find most of it rather funny, because it is in fact just a cartoon.Something I must complain about though, is some of the long running gags...For example, the Conway Twitty bits...For those of you who may not have had the misfortune of encountering an episode which uses a Conway Twitty bit, this is how it goes...Peter finds himself in a situation in which he needs a temporary distraction, he then says...Ladies and Gentlemen Mr. Conway Twitty! and from there the scene cuts to an old video clip of Conway Twitty performing a song. This would be bearable if it only lasted 10 seconds or so...But these bits often times can last between 5 and 10 minutes. When you factor in that the with commercials removed each episode is only about 22 minutes long, that's almost half an episode dedicated to Conway Twitty. I watch Family Guy to laugh at the Griffin family and all of their misfortune. Not to watch old Conway Twitty performance's...Another thing I feel the need to nitpick is the musicals. Family Guy has had extravagant drawn out musical bits since the shows conception, and I personally have NEVER liked them. To me they just don't add anything to the show. On a plus side though when a musical bit does arise, I take it a chance to get something to drink and/or go to the bathroom, in essence its like a mini commercial break for me.The last thing I feel needs to be criticized about Family Guy is the pop culture references. Often times the show makes fun or reference's an actor or performer who I would be willing to be 90% of the show's audience doesn't even know who they are.Anyway with my personal nitpicks aside I have to say that overall I still do enjoy Family Guy and generally I can still expect at least a couple of good hard laughs per episode. If you think Family Guy's humor is to offensive then you probably shouldn't be watching it anyway, remember...As I said earlier, this is a Cartoon sitcom, not real life. Family Guy has even made cracks at things I personally could have found offensive if I wanted to...But I just laughed at it.If you have never seen a Family Guy episode before, watch it with an open mind and you will probably enjoy it.

It's just not funny. Maybe a chuckle here and there but overall, vastly disappointing in how they're moving this once slightly-above-mediocre show to the depths of soon to be cancelled tv shows. South Park, rick & morty, bobs burgers, archer, and so many more have surpassed plotness nonsense.

I have never seen a funnier or smarter show on TV.  The absolute comedic gems in "The Simpsons" that come along at best once every few episodes are churned out with amazing regularity on "Family Guy".  Every time I see a new episode, I pick up on another brilliant subtlety.  The humor plays on things that you've always known are funny in the back of your mind, but have never explicitly thought of.  "The Simpsons" and "South Park" are intelligent, often on or near the level of "Family Guy," but they both pull too many punches with the jokes (less so with "South Park," but its humor is more disturbing), and as a result don't inspire as many debilitating laughs. "Family Guy" is the perfect balance of raw humor and wry, subtle references. There has never been a better animated comedy on TV.

It seems quite a number of people are familiar with this show, but my two cents are that while it has some decent moments, it falls flat for quite a few reasons.Family Guy is a cartoon that premiered on the American TV network FOX in the late 90's. It follows the life of Peter Griffin, his wife, Lois, and the rest of their odd family and many wild and dysfunctional characters they meet.This show would be a lot more engaging if the plots were more focused on. I feel this show lacks structure, and relies too much on sight gags rather than an actual plot. For example, the main characters will "flash back" to something (usually a pop-culture reference to an actor, movie, so on. Sometimes involving the characters themselves engaging with the person or event), which appears to be played for laughs, and usually breaking the "fourth wall" in the process. This wouldn't be so bad normally, but they do this to the point where it takes up at least half the show, eating away any sort of plot.Second, there is too much crudeness in this show for my taste. I don't mind the dark, twisted humor that appears every once in a while and sometimes the mild adult aimed innuendo, the potty humor gets me. Programs such as "The Simpsons'', "South Park", "Futurama" and some other shows do have jokes about "grotesque" things, but they play it low, as Simpsons do, or often in the case of South Park, wrap into into a clever joke that is a nitpick or stab at the corruption and incompetence in our society. This show often feels like a string of fart jokes sometimes that is not clever or funny.This show also seems to recycle gags and jokes from previous episodes, such as the title character abusing his daughter (which got old, fast), his toddler son's closeted homosexuality and tendencies, and overused "flash back gags" as I mentioned above. (One involving them cutting away to a old music video of musicians such as Conway Twitty or Glen Campbell have gotten quite tedious.) And sometimes a joke will drag on for quite a while. (One episode that was parodying "Star Wars: Return of the Jedi" featured the title character, Peter Griffin, cuing several characters while a build up that parodied the scene in which Han Solo had to defeat The Sarlac and Boba Fett.Perhaps this show is not that bad, often times I feel it is trying to play off of success of programs such as "The Simpsons", "South Park" or "King of the Hill". Though this show has it's moments and some quite clever jokes, be warned, as the plots of this show are lacking, and the humor might not be for some.

At first when I saw this show, it was good. But as the show went on, it got less creative, repetitive, and annoyingly random. The show began not to have any flow to it, and have all spots without substance. Too many random flashbacks take away from the whole theme of most shows. The jokes are cheap humor, as they love to make fun of pop-culture. This show is an overall disaster, and people think it is cool because its "edgy" and "controversial"In retrospect, the show is awful. If you never seen it, don't even try it out. It is a waste of time. There are plenty of better shows out there, so don't waste your time.

I find, looking back, the earlier seasons of Family Guy are, overall (can't stress that enough)better than the newer seasons. In earlier seasons (2-6) there are plots written far better than those of newer seasons (7-12). However, in a show like this, plot is not as important compared to other genres because, in the long run, its all about laughter and entertainment (plot is still good...need good plot). Like MOST comedy TV hits, Family Guy is running low on new material, even though new material is achieved through the events and situations of the real world that will always continue. I still find it to be hilarious, I just feel if you picked 10 random episodes from seasons 2-6, I would probably rate 8/10 better than 10 randomly picked episodes from 7-12. (I exclude season 1 based on the fact that they were just getting started and they weren't all that great in my opinion)The show is full of laughs and shock but even heartfelt moments at times (especially in season 12...if you know what I mean) and that makes this show great. It was better, but it still holds up. Raunchy, original (for the most part), enjoyable, stupid and most importantly...FUN!
