This is the best cartoon show of all time better then the simpons.The jokes are brilliant and characters are funny as hell.If you like jokes about religion and won't get affended i prefer you watch this.But what I don't understnad why they cancelled it?????????????????

I started watching Family Guy the first time it aired, right after the super bowl. Eventually I lost track of the show due to FOX's sporadic scheduling of the show which was the cause for the low ratings it received. I caught an episode here and there later in its run, and even managed to tape a few episodes. I remember very specifically the last episode I saw was "Road to Rhode Island". One day I thought, hey Family Guy, that was a funny show... I realized that the DVD was out and that it was running on Adult Swim, I soon fell in love with the show again.This show is mostly for adults, but it contains humor suitable for everyone. I've come to the conclusion there are many different levels of humor in Family Guy. Unfortunately the show is often referred to as "low-brow" which is far from the truth. A lot of people don't pay close enough attention to the show and quickly pass it off as "stupid". The show does contain some toilet humor, ridiculous jokes, and plain stupidity at some points. But that's not what the show is based around. I'm quite fond of the more "high-brow" jokes, and references that are made in the show, and I can tell you that these far outdo the lesser intelligent part of the show. There is also a great mixture of New England culture and references made throughout the show. You really need to see all the episodes to appreciate the show as much as it was meant to be appreciated. You also seem to have to know a thing or two about the show's background to really realize how brilliant it can be at some times... For example when Mayor Adam West says "I've delt with supervillans before" it's a clear reference to him being Batman (the voice of Adam West is used for the character Mayor Adam West), and then some.There is really a lot to the show, and the more you watch it, the more you pick up on it. I recently realized how well the episodes `Love thy Trophy', `The King is Dead', and `Running Mates' are written. In these three episodes they really use the characters a lot, and you really learn more about who the characters really are (of course there are similar episodes that do the same, see: Brian: Portrait of a dog, Road to Rhode Island, etc). A lot of people pass the shows plots off as thin, and the characters undeveloped. Once again, this is far from the truth, you actually need to WATCH the show to see that this is far from the truth. Each character, flashback, and flash cut are used for a reason for future or current plots somewhere in the show, no matter how obscure they may seem. There are also specific episodes where the writers went into detail about certain characters. Such as when the writers added the `Evil Monkey' to help elaborate on Chris' character. Chris is a big kid for his age, but he has a mind of a child. A common misconception is that this show is racist. It's not, any racist comments come from Peter, and Peter is a bigot, loudmouth, who talks before he thinks. So naturally, if you haven't paid attention to the show you would see it to be racist. They channel this attitude through Peter sometimes just to get the point across that he is just an idiot.

You can never be bored with this show. It clings to your soul. Although it is not a drama, it still clings to your soul. What is better than watching an obese man making fart jokes. Nah ha ha ha. The great thing about this show is that it is always fresh. Whenever you watch it there's rarely any "To be continued" or "Next time on Family Guy". You never have to have that unwanted suspense of what will happen. You could buy the DVD to it and just sit watching and laughing at the politically incorrect humor.

This extremely funny show is on almost every night on the Cartoon Network. It shows at I believe 11:30 PM Eastern time (USA) during the week. Great humor and the baby especially is enough to make you howl!! Peter Griffin is an idiot who seems to have no problem doing the insane things he does with no compunction ( is that a word?). Lois seems to have a lot of pent up emotions contained most of the time but every once in a while they explode and she becomes another person. The two older kids are hilarious. Just two teenagers; a daughter who hates her family and a son who is too stupid most of the time to know what is going on around him. But like almost all teenage boys he is a testosterone machine and it's girls and sex on the brain all the time. The dog is the most intelligent one in the family, if you discount little Stewie, who has a closet that Luke Skywalker would kill for.The neighbors are a riot, including the single guy next door who has the hots for Lois and in fact has pictures of her all over his bedroom closet!!I found the show by accident one night while channel surfing and I'm glad I did. Even my wife thinks it's funny!!!

i disagree with your portrayal that family guy is not as smart and witty as the Simpson's. I'm a regular family guy and Simpson's viewer and i believe that family guy is funnier than Simpson's in many situations and family is more consistent. because if you have noticed the Simpson's is just no good anymore. The newer seasons are not funny not smart and definitely not witty. They are just...stupid. Homer is too dumb, Marge is too straight Lisa...well is Lisa and Bart does not have the appeal to the younger viewers as he did in earlier episodes. I remember liking Bart because of his rebellion ( what ever happened to eat my shorts!) The family guy however never slips up and is consistently funny and hasn't dropped in humor as it ages in seasons. i know that Simpson's is older than family guy, but you are saying that family guy still has not wit and is just plain stupid. Seth McFarlane has struck gold with this show. it may seem dumb at first, but if you keep watching you can see genius of it. Family Guy has great characters, including Peter, the dumb, overweight father who's always getting his family into big trouble, Lois, the patient mother who is sometimes pushed over the top, Chris, the fat, dimwitted son who is haunted by an evil monkey, Meg, the whiny high-school girl who doesn't fit in with anyone, Brian, the talking dog of the family who is the smartest there, and Stewie, the merciless baby who is bent on world domination and intends on killing Lois. After watching this show, I guarantee you'll be hooked.
